Title: Re: update
Post by: 911911 on November 13, 2012, 05:23 pm
This thread has turned to complete stupid... Noobs asking what 'OP' and 'LE' means, Junkies and "Vendors" (I'm pretty convinced most the hate in this thread is coming from hard drug users facing withdrawals, and that many self-professed "Vendors" who are "loosing tons of money" are just your average fiend upset they can't make orders) whining and crying because they can't get their fix, and the worst amount of conspiratard (sry to use an ableist term if it upsets anyone) crap I've ever seen in my whole life on the internet (and I basically live on reddit and /b/). This thread is so full of stupid it hurts!

Please, everyone, STFU and let the SR Staff and DPR do their job so hopefully our awesome drug paradise can come back!

PS - All you junkies crying like children cause your fix will take longer, go get hookups IRL for hell's sake! How the fuck did you get into drugs in the first place? If it was on SR you found your DOC that you're now addicted to than you deserve all the withdrawals you're suffering right now...

I doubt it. I would guess that it takes an average of two weeks for a bitcoin to come into SR in a buyers hands and leave in a sellers hand.

If $1m in drug sales are made in the two weeks, then he would get $1m, but he could wait and keep it running and get only $100k of that.

Title: Re: update
Post by: 16384 on November 13, 2012, 05:31 pm

Last couple of posts point to LE as an issue or culprit of the downtime. I do not believe this is the case. The events that have transpired are not indicative of LE infiltration. Other then the possibility massive hardware failure the only remaining issue is hackers.  SR was compromised by hackers most likely after the stored BTC. With out any major blockchain moves they where probably unable to breach SR financial systrm. I am sire they did some damage to the site or stole information as barganing chips. DPR is probably trying to close the security breach and or negotiating with whoever compromised the site.

Like I said earlier: we (vendors) are the clients here and DPR is failing miserably to deliver the product we have paid for (the site) or to at least keep up up to date on its status.

Yes, they are being very vague and the story isn't adding up.

DPR said that it was a surprise in the first post, but on the website it says scheduled maintenance.

There are a few things that I believe could be happening right now:
1) SR was unexpectedly downed and DPR lied about the maintenance being scheduled for some reason.
2) SR is changing or expanding hosts and DPR doesn't want us to know for anonymity and security reasons.
3) SR was taken over by feds and they are in the process of modifying SR to addresses are logged to them. (not too likely, but there is a chance)
4) SR was downed unexpectedly and they are upgrading the security

1,2 and 4 are correct
1. - DPR has come on and said he has been away for 24hours to find out silk road was down and only he can get it up again. He hasnt lied about maintence, the maintence came up when he got back because it is maintence now even though it was not scheduled.
2. He maybe changing/expanding hosts now so when it comes up it doesnt go down straightaway and yes he cant say to much for security and anonymity reasons, he has to be safe.
4. yep both i reckon

:)

Title: Re: update
Post by: poolsclosed on November 13, 2012, 06:29 pm
Quote from: modziw on November 13, 2012, 02:38 pm
[Provigil/Nuvigil] is so fucking sweet. No high, no jitters, no addictive properties.
I was prescribed Provigil (modafinil) for my narcolepsy. It cracked me out, like having had several large cups of coffee (with quad shots of espresso, yum). Very VERY bad jitters, mild nausea, and it left me in a talkative and scatterbrained state. It also put me in a foul mood. It has more than once been the result of me talking too much and getting myself in trouble.

The only thing that has truly worked for me is d-amphetamine. It is euphoric, but it has a rational high and no jitters. At least, for me. And it's been studied much more than modafinil...

Just a reminder to you people requesting that your SR wallet balances be sent to emergency addresses... seeing that high volume of BTC activity would be a red flag for any LE following the events here, and it would help them trace SR users. It would be a huge security risk.

Title: Re: update
Post by: mode on November 13, 2012, 07:16 pm
Quote from: damaged on November 13, 2012, 07:00 pm
Quote from: paxpax on November 13, 2012, 04:24 pm
Last couple of posts point to LE as an issue or culprit of the downtime. I do not believe this is the case. The events that have transpired are not indicative of LE infiltration. Other then the possibility massive hardware failure the only remaining issue is hackers.  SR was compromised by hackers most likely after the stored BTC. With out any major blockchain moves they where probably unable to breach SR financial systrm. I am sire they did some damage to the site or stole information as barganing chips. DPR is probably trying to close the security breach and or negotiating with whoever compromised the site.

I bet it's even more mundane than that. SR is a custom software platform. The advantage compared to an out-of-the-box CMS solution like Drupal is that you don't have to spend time reading and understanding someone else's code, and removing unnecessary "features" that are potential security threats. The disadvantage is that you don't have a large team of coders and thousands of beta testers. So it appears the SR platform has some critical bugs that greatly reduce performance, and now a tiny team (possibly only DPR) has to fix everything while the rabble goes all apeshit with conspiracy theories.

+1

Title: Re: update
Post by: dirkdiggler5151 on November 13, 2012, 07:24 pm
I would have to disagree that if LE took the site down that they'd have some big announcement on Google news or something like that.  In fact, I would expect them to milk the information from behind the scenes for as long as possible versus tipping everyone off that it has been busted.

One thing that can't be denied is that the Bitcoin got hammered down around Oct 26/27 and that event coincided with one of the main BTC vendors on SR going down WELL BEFORE the SR outage.  Possibly someone on the inside got tipped off that a bust was coming and then sold off their coins.

Another reason that I believe you have not heard very much information from DPR or the site admins is that if LE is actually in control of the site, they do not want to tip people off by posting long drawn out posts which may sound or appear to be out of character or different in writing style from the real DPR. 

As far as those that think the site is well protected and that LE would never be able to find out where the server was located, I would have to disagree with that also.  Even though the IP may be hidden, I am fairly confident that you could flood the site with traffic at non peak times and then monitor the corresponding traffic through the major networks to see where the packets went. 

I hope I am wrong.

Yes, that's the good question, there were several transactions of about 12.000 BTC which is very large unusual amount.

No, you can check my posting history here... been on here for a while and spent somewhere around $11k on SR with another $2k that I just added to my account to make another large purchase right before the site went down. I've never even visited BMR and don't intend to.
I'm not accusing DPR of anything, but it is curious that just a step from transactions that I know were to SR show activity right now. And by right now I mean literally minutes ago. Look for yourself if you've recently added funds to SR...
I would think it's just a mixing algorithm, except it doesn't seem to be mixing, just moving - and these were funds that sat in a big wallet for a long time and just started moving today. Why?

Title: Re: update
Post by: kitkat82 on November 13, 2012, 08:15 pm
Quote from: dirkdiggler5151 on November 13, 2012, 07:24 pm
I would have to disagree that if LE took the site down that they'd have some big announcement on Google news or something like that.  In fact, I would expect them to milk the information from behind the scenes for as long as possible versus tipping everyone off that it has been busted.

One thing that can't be denied is that the Bitcoin got hammered down around Oct 26/27 and that event coincided with one of the main BTC vendors on SR going down WELL BEFORE the SR outage.  Possibly someone on the inside got tipped off that a bust was coming and then sold off their coins.

Another reason that I believe you have not heard very much information from DPR or the site admins is that if LE is actually in control of the site, they do not want to tip people off by posting long drawn out posts which may sound or appear to be out of character or different in writing style from the real DPR. 

As far as those that think the site is well protected and that LE would never be able to find out where the server was located, I would have to disagree with that also.  Even though the IP may be hidden, I am fairly confident that you could flood the site with traffic at non peak times and then monitor the corresponding traffic through the major networks to see where the packets went. 

I hope I am wrong.

I hope you are wrong too. 

To all the people who are afraid that rational, respectful comments like this will drive DPR to decide not to host SR for us any longer....you guys are acting like junkies too, so pot meet kettle.  Are you saying that you think DPR is so fickle and egotistical that he can't handle people making harmless conjectures which in no way attack his character? Even the nasty comments, I can't believe you people think that he would let those be the only deciding factor for his pet project.

Come on people, you are ass kissing because you are afraid your site will be shut down.  Let's call a spade a spade.  None of us want SR to be shut down.  We are all here for the drugs.  Quit trying to make yourself out to be above everyone else just because you are afraid to breathe too loud in the presence of the admins.  Quit calling people junkies when it is obvious that you would fall in that category too.  Quit putting on airs because you smoke pot or take shrooms. I have met plenty of people living dead end "junkie" lives who "just smoke weed".  I have also met people with families and careers who do cocaine or take lots of pain pills.  It doesn't necessarily follow that pot=better.

I think DPR is way too open minded, rational and sane to let a few nasty comments and a bunch of well thought out theories change his mind about his life's work.  Come on now, use your brains. You can't really mean what you are saying.

Other then the possibility massive hardware failure the only remaining issue is hackers.  SR was compromised by hackers most likely after the stored BTC. With out any major blockchain moves they where probably unable to breach SR financial systrm. I am sire they did some damage to the site or stole information as barganing chips. DPR is probably trying to close the security breach and or negotiating with whoever compromised the site.

The problem is that no matter the reason we DESERVE the know what the fuck is going on. Hackers, OK, but tell us. LE, ok, tell us, fucked up hardware, how hard is it to just fucking tell.

Like I said earlier: we (vendors) are the clients here and DPR is failing miserably to deliver the product we have paid for (the site) or to at least keep up up to date on its status.

Yes, they are being very vague and the story isn't adding up.

DPR said that it was a surprise in the first post, but on the website it says scheduled maintenance.

There are a few things that I believe could be happening right now:
1) SR was unexpectedly downed and DPR lied about the maintenance being scheduled for some reason.
2) SR is changing or expanding hosts and DPR doesn't want us to know for anonymity and security reasons.
3) SR was taken over by feds and they are in the process of modifying SR to addresses are logged to them. (not too likely, but there is a chance)
4) SR was downed unexpectedly and they are upgrading the security

There is option 5 as well (which I hope is not true)
5) DPR pulled off a pirateat40

I doubt it. I would guess that it takes an average of two weeks for a bitcoin to come into SR in a buyers hands and leave in a sellers hand.

If $1m in drug sales are made in the two weeks, then he would get $1m, but he could wait and keep it running and get only $100k of that.

Basically, DPR has the choice between $1m and no continuous income or $200k/mo

As long as we're throwing around theories...This doesn't take into account the amount of stuck coin in every buyer/vendor account in the system when the site went down. That figure might be a litte higher than $1m. Who knows how many users keep that as their main wallet because of the added security it offers. The same random key system that launders your btc to keep your transactions anonymous is just how he's cashing out every account to hide the huge transactions in the blockchain. The emergency backup wallet address system leads to his gox accounts.If he started cashing out 5 or 6 days ago, that money is long gone and certainly would explain the 40 cent dip over the weekend. With more to come immediately once the rest of the rubes on here realize it's never coming back. Maybe he is pirateat40. In that case i'd agree that he is the true genius you asshole lickers say he is.
Nobody expected this site to last forever.

1.). Around October 26/27 the price of Bitcoin dropped due to to heavy selling volume.  Also around this same time, one of the biggest bitcoin vendors on SR went offline and stated that he was down due to 'SR problems and network difficulties'.  This vendor continued with this message the week of 11/5 up until the SR outage.
2.). There has been very little communication from the site admins.  I am guessing that there was some type of dead man switch on the site which trashed the server in the event that the admin had been captured.  LE is probably scrambling to rebuild the site right now and put that bogus maintenance screen up to calm everyones fears.

Thoughts?
Nahh, if that was the case, I'm sure someone in the team or someone somehow associated with SR would have a way of coming on here and letting people know its been compromised. No way in the world that LE could recreate SR in a couple of days, if there was a kill switch i'm sure it would of deleted everything, right? Which means all accounts and histories etc.

I also think people overestimate the amount of LE resourced being used here. Exactly how would LE "capture DPR"? It should be virtually impossible if he takes the right precautions, which I am convinced he does. And if they did, why would they want to keep the site running? There are a few things that I believe could be happening right now:
1) SR was unexpectedly downed and DPR lied about the maintenance being scheduled for some reason.
2) SR is changing or expanding hosts and DPR doesn't want us to know for anonymity and security reasons.
3) SR was taken over by feds and they are in the process of modifying SR to addresses are logged to them. (not too likely, but there is a chance)
4) SR was downed unexpectedly and they are upgrading the security

There is option 5 as well (which I hope is not true)
5) DPR pulled off a pirateat40

I doubt it. I would guess that it takes an average of two weeks for a bitcoin to come into SR in a buyers hands and leave in a sellers hand.

If $1m in drug sales are made in the two weeks, then he would get $1m, but he could wait and keep it running and get only $100k of that.

Basically, DPR has the choice between $1m and no continuous income or $200k/mo

That figure might be a litte higher than $1m. Who knows how many users keep that as their main wallet because of the added security it offers. The same random key system that launders your btc to keep your transactions anonymous is just how he's cashing out every account to hide the huge transactions in the blockchain. The emergency backup wallet address system leads to his gox accounts.If he started cashing out 5 or 6 days ago, that money is long gone and certainly would explain the 40 cent dip over the weekend. Title: Re: update
Post by: QualityMeds on November 13, 2012, 10:06 pm
First, for all my customers (I'm a vendor on SR by the same name, QualityMeds), as soon as SR is back up, all orders will be shipped promptly. I don't see it taking more than one or two days to get all the pending orders shipped. Also, I still offer free samples of everything I sell, read my profile/signature at the end of my post here for my items. Message me with your name/shipping address and what samples you want to try out.

About this situation: I think it's so funny how people overreact to these down times. I've been a vendor on other sites and forums for many years. I would go away for a few days on business and would return to people posting every conspiracy theory in the book, from LE busting me to me running away with all their money. People cry scammer so easily. I don't blame them though, nearly everyone who cries scammer is someone who has been scammed in the past. It's too bad, if it weren't for all those filthy scammers, we wouldn't have anything to worry about. They ruin it for the rest of us honest vendors.

Yes, it is true that sometimes it is a scam and the seller/vendor will run away with your money. But one thing I've noticed, and this holds true 95% of the time - when you've really been scammed, all communication ceases. The fact that DPR is updating us every 5 hours is the best sign. If he wanted to run away with all of our money then he wouldn't be wasting his time updating us on the status of the site. In fact, after he emptied all the bitcoin into his own wallet, he would have probably just shut it all down and put the server offline, to cut any ties. He definitely would not be wasting his time updating us on the status, he'd be on some tropical island sipping margaritas on a beach probably his own island as I'm sure he has the money to afford that LOL.

The fact is that SR makes a hell of a lot more money for DPR by being up. What is the point in scamming everyone? He sounds like a standup guy in my opinion, and besides the money he makes, what he's doing is more important than money. It is a freedom to put in your body what you choose, one step closer to defeating this insane war on drugs, which has cost more lives than it has saved and has cost the taxpayers in the United States a shit-ton of money by filling up our jails with low-level drug dealers or just users, creating ex-cons who don't have a chance to reintegrate into society when they get out of jail because of the ex-con stigma, essentially ruining their lives. 50 years from now, we'll look at this the same way we look at the freedom of speech, and wonder how crazy it was when the governments would put people in jail for smoking weed or sniffing a few lines of coke, or selling a couple ounces of pot. Thank god that Colorado and Washington have set the first precedents and have made marijuana completely legal for recreational use by those 21 or over, giving it the same status as alcohol. It's about time!

Thanks DPR for all you are doing. I'm sure you and your team are doing the best you can to bring SR back up and running. It's worth the wait to get it running faster and smoother.

QualityMeds
"QM"

Maybe real DPR has sold SR few months ago. Check this out:

 "What troubles especially paranoid Silk Road is that DPR is usually a voluble presence on board. In honor of 4/20, he held a massive drug sale on Silk Road, which was advertised as including a giveaway with a grand prize of "a trip for two with all the trimmings to paradise, all expenses included." But he's only posted on Silk Road forums three times since May 6th.
"Does anyone else find it strange that DPR's post count dropped significantly?" asked a user today. "I never payed much attention to it before until a friend mentioned that some major MDMA distributors from the NW USA heard about the operators of [Silk Road] getting caught. I brushed it off as a rumor until I looked through DPR's post count and now I'm a bit concerned. I know this is pure speculation as I have no evidence or reliable source, It just seems like something worthy of discussing." "

Title: Re: update
Post by: californiadude on November 13, 2012, 11:57 pm
Alright, so I hope I'm not being naive in my quick analysis here. Let's just think about law enforcement taking over.

So we have three privacy mechanisms (granted, one of which some users don't always use...):
PGP
TOR
Bitcoin

Using PGP, there is virtually no way for LE to get your information unless the vendor is compromised. Even so, because it is tor, they have almost no way of getting the information about the actual user, provided they are browsing carefully with no scripts enabled.

Anyways, say they get this address. They can't do anything immediately. It is not illegal for drugs to be ordered to your address. Besides being backed by the law, this also makes sense...  I could otherwise send drugs to a person I detest in order to get them arrested. The only way you can be arrested from this action is if upon arrival you either sign for the package OR it is found to be open (from a raid) without your calling the police. If you leave it unopened for ~8 hours afterwards, you are probably safe for the second part. Even so, this could only really happen if you didn't use PGP... If the vendor is compromised, they can't still send drugs your way just to get you arrested. I mean, LE can do some stupid shit, but that is clearly illegal.

Well, not a thorough analysis, but I think I covered the major points.

TL;DR Stfu you guys, we're fine.

Title: Re: update
Post by: Lucydrop on November 14, 2012, 12:24 am
New update on the first page for people who dont know he is posting his updates in the original post

FROM DPR:

UPDATE (0012 UTC):  Sorry I'm late on this update, won't happen again.  We're pretty much polishing and going down the final check list at this point.  I'm confident we'll make our "matter of days" estimate and this won't be drawn out into week+ territory (assuming nothing goes wrong when we reopen).  When we reopen, access will be limited to vendors only for a few hours so they can mark packages shipped that were sent but not marked before we went down.  Also, auto-finalize and auto-vacation haven't been running since Sunday, and we won't fire those back up for a couple of days after we reopen so everyone can get square first.  Can't wait till this is behind us

Title: Re: update
Post by: realXimpact on November 14, 2012, 12:35 am
I'm surprised no one has brought up a great reason why the 12,000 BTC (about $120,000USD) thing is bunk. It's very simple- That's a laughably small number of BTC compared to the commission made off the whole site's transactions in just one month.

Even JUST using the USA domestic cannabis category for some simple calculations.... I estimate the top vendors move about $2000-5000 of product in a given week based on feedback frequency and checking the item descriptions for those feedback. NCK, Rook, Tweetb and many others crush $2000 a week bare minimum.. So that's an easy $10,000 a week for 5 top vendors, $40,000 in a month. There's dozens more active vendors in just Cannabis alone, I would say even $200,000 from all domestic cannabis vendors in a month is a very VERY low number. Commission is somewhere in between 6-10%, and 10% off that $200k is $20,000 in a month for commission.

Then factor in that there's dozens of drug/other categories and vendors all over the world, custom and private listings, and people that don't leave feedback... that $20,000 from cannabis seems very small. Taking 12k BTC lump sum against a constant and cumulative commission rate like that is just financially retarded.

edit- 120k to 12k BTC in the last line.

Title: Re: update
Post by: Nancy23 on November 14, 2012, 01:07 am
Look...I'm officially calling out the asshole who calls themselves, "iHateNiggers:"

If this asshole were to meet me in person on a street corner anywhere in the entire United States of America (including Alaska and Hawaii), would this idiot have the courage to call me a "nigger" to my fucking face!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   I THINK NOT.    The internet (whether its clearnet or darknet) is anonymous.   So, I say, HELL THE FUCK NO!!!  It's because, this idiot is "all hat and now cattle."  That's right, this is a term out of the great American state of Texas.

Look, as a "nigger" in this idiot's book, here's how I see what's going on here:

1) DPR wants everybody on his website to be safe.   If we are all safe then he and his crew are safe.  End of story!!!!! 

2) When there's high demand for anything (including the fucking Internets);  the supplier of that demand much tread carefully.   What's the use of higher demand if suppliers can't safely supply the demand. 

3)  There are so many veterans of what SR was in the past and if they can keep the faith, then I can.   

4)  Silk Road is just not a site that has been overtaken by LE.   LE want their presence to be known.   Even if they are behind the scenes collecting evidence in which they bring somebody down.   Ultimately, they want their final product to be something that everybody can see far and wide (even on the internets).    Somebody else on these forums mentioned "Megaupload."   Well, guess what, this is a good example.   Here's another example I can point at, "Isohunt."    This site was not closed down by the authorities, but they settled in court and it's clear that they did that.   

However, here's where I disagree with DPR:

4) Look baby, I know you are trying to be safe, but I just received two orders I managed to make right before SR went down completely.   These orders are in escrow and I really, really, really wish I could finalize these orders.    I got these orders safe and sound, and I wish pay these vendors as they deserve.   One vendor has just sent me more of what may become my favorite weed strain of all time....Atomic Northern Lights!!!!   And another vendor was able to send me a strain of weed that I've been anxious to try because I was a former Girl Scout...that's right Girl Scout Cookies!  That's right, "iHateNiggers," this nigger was actually a Girl Scout!!!!  Suck on my swollen clit and quivering pussyhole, you asshole!!!!

5) This Mises (or Austrian Economics) BS just doesn't work.   However, I'm willing to debate DPR in another forum on this issue.   I'm still patient with DPR because they are still are great.  They have shifted the mainstream paradigm despite themselves.  And for that, I am thankful and grateful. 

That's enough out of me.  I have bitcoins ready to spend on whatever SR presents to me.   Yet, I still want to be safe.   And despite everything I've done up to this point, I'm still safe.   And I thank DPR for that.

Post by: fredflintstone on November 14, 2012, 01:17 am
Quote from: realXimpact on November 14, 2012, 12:35 am
I'm surprised no one has brought up a great reason why the 12,000 BTC (about $120,000USD) thing is bunk. It's very simple- That's a laughably small number of BTC compared to the commission made off the whole site's transactions in just one month.

Even JUST using the USA domestic cannabis category for some simple calculations.... I estimate the top vendors move about $2000-5000 of product in a given week based on feedback frequency and checking the item descriptions for those feedback. NCK, Rook, Tweetb and many others crush $2000 a week bare minimum.. So that's an easy $10,000 a week for 5 top vendors, $40,000 in a month. There's dozens more active vendors in just Cannabis alone, I would say even $200,000 from all domestic cannabis vendors in a month is a very VERY low number. Commission is somewhere in between 6-10%, and 10% off that $200k is $20,000 in a month for commission.

Then factor in that there's dozens of drug/other categories and vendors all over the world, custom and private listings, and people that don't leave feedback... that $20,000 from cannabis seems very small. Taking 12k BTC lump sum against a constant and cumulative commission rate like that is just financially retarded.

edit- 120k to 12k BTC in the last line.

Yeah I was gonna interject, but its pointless trying to convince people here lol.

I ALONE have 1675BTC in limbo there .. and I am not even that large of a vendor. All the MOM, NL MDMA, Coke guys etc ... There is likely in the neighborhood of 100000BTC on the site, not 12000 lol

@TheGoodson .. you think that troll has BTC on SR ? He's a goof, leave him be.

Look...I'm officially calling out the asshole who calls themselves, "iHateNiggers:"

If this asshole were to meet me in person on a street corner anywhere in the entire United States of America (including Alaska and Hawaii), would this idiot have the courage to call me a "nigger" to my fucking face!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   I THINK NOT.    The internet (whether its clearnet or darknet) is anonymous.   So, I say, HELL THE FUCK NO!!!  It's because, this idiot is "all hat and now cattle."  That's right, this is a term out of the great American state of Texas.

Look, as a "nigger" in this idiot's book, here's how I see what's going on here:

1) DPR wants everybody on his website to be safe.   If we are all safe then he and his crew are safe.  End of story!!!!! 

2) When there's high demand for anything (including the fucking Internets);  the supplier of that demand much tread carefully.   What's the use of higher demand if suppliers can't safely supply the demand. 

3)  There are so many veterans of what SR was in the past and if they can keep the faith, then I can.   

4)  Silk Road is just not a site that has been overtaken by LE.   LE want their presence to be known.   Even if they are behind the scenes collecting evidence in which they bring somebody down.   Ultimately, they want their final product to be something that everybody can see far and wide (even on the internets).    Somebody else on these forums mentioned "Megaupload."   Well, guess what, this is a good example.   Here's another example I can point at, "Isohunt."    This site was not closed down by the authorities, but they settled in court and it's clear that they did that.   

However, here's where I disagree with DPR:

4) Look baby, I know you are trying to be safe, but I just received two orders I managed to make right before SR went down completely.   These orders are in escrow and I really, really, really wish I could finalize these orders.    I got these orders safe and sound, and I wish pay these vendors as they deserve.   One vendor has just sent me more of what may become my favorite weed strain of all time....Atomic Northern Lights!!!!   And another vendor was able to send me a strain of weed that I've been anxious to try because I was a former Girl Scout...that's right Girl Scout Cookies!  That's right, "iHateNiggers," this nigger was actually a Girl Scout!!!!  Suck on my swollen clit and quivering pussyhole, you asshole!!!!

5) This Mises (or Austrian Economics) BS just doesn't work.   However, I'm willing to debate DPR in another forum on this issue.   I'm still patient with DPR because they are still are great.  They have shifted the mainstream paradigm despite themselves.  And for that, I am thankful and grateful. 

That's enough out of me.  I have bitcoins ready to spend on whatever SR presents to me.   Yet, I still want to be safe.   And despite everything I've done up to this point, I'm still safe.   And I thank DPR for that.

I love Black People.They are so beautiful,so brave,so funny(I mean they know how to enjoy and amuse people around themselves).They(and I should add natives too) deserve the best conditions of life more than anyone else in the world...especially after all that history of shame written by the white men.My heart(and I believe most of us) will always with you and your sisters and brothers Nancy23. :)

Title: Re: update
Post by: hootersmcboob on November 14, 2012, 02:22 am
Quote from: damaged on November 14, 2012, 02:01 am
Quote from: DaveTheRave on November 14, 2012, 01:54 am
Doesn't SR have a built in tumbler? Could that account for your "missing" coins?

Has nobody ever bothered to look at their SR address in the block chain? Yeah, within hours of transferring coins to it, they get moved into the tumbler. Meanwhile, your account is credited with whatever you transferred to it -- which is in a separate database -- while in the block chain your SR address has a final balance of 0.


Okay, bitinstant shows *everything* as zero, so that's not really a great way to tell all the time

Title: Re: update
Post by: DutchKoekiemonster on November 14, 2012, 02:38 am
Quote
It is a freedom to put in your body what you choose, one step closer to defeating this insane war on drugs, which has cost more lives than it has saved and has cost the taxpayers in the United States a shit-ton of money by filling up our jails with low-level drug dealers or just users, creating ex-cons who don't have a chance to reintegrate into society when they get out of jail because of the ex-con stigma, essentially ruining their lives. 50 years from now, we'll look at this the same way we look at the freedom of speech, and wonder how crazy it was when the governments would put people!e in jail for smoking weed or sniffing a few lines of coke, or selling a couple ounces of pot.

Totally agree on that. Here in the Netherlands you can roll and smoke a ten inch joint at a public place in front of a police officer - me and my friends seriously done that multiple times back in the days when we where kids. Don't get me wrong I'm not an advocate for kids using drugs! In the coffeshops here you definitely heard about they are really strict in not selling to kids under eighteen. But there's no way of stopping kids from getting there dope that's impossible in my opinion.. The only thing we can do about that is through prevention campaigns witch could be paid out of tax profits from drug sales if we would actually regulate drugs..

At a big dance party in case someone is careless and one holds xtc pills in his pocked instead of his boxer shorts and the security finds it you have to hand them in and they just let you join the party (in most cases). If you hold more than ten pills they consider you as a dealer and its possible that they make a case / process verbal of it witch could eventually result in a money penalty or at worst a work punishment. This means you have to clean the streets, washing dishes in a nursing home or guide traffic on a big event or something. Correct me if I'm wrong but that 'work punishment' is something that not exists in the States isn't it? If you are sentenced in this way (witch happened to me actually) you're not suffering much stigma here and you're still able to go to collage and acquire a proper job. We don't put people in jail and fucking there life's up for.. nothing. There are many test centers here where you can have your drugs tested so there's less contaminated drugs in circulation and if there is the institute that monitors the marked here send out warnings. If we look at the facts there are less hard drug users here, less problematic drug users and less drug related deaths.....

Think and hope SR will be back soon.. I also lost quite a bit of money if it isn't but it isn't the end of the world if DPR or LE fucked us. Soon there will be better alternatives than the BMR don't ya think?

Title: Re: update
Post by: Auscention on November 14, 2012, 03:16 am
Quote from: TiredOfThisBullshit on November 14, 2012, 03:12 am
Quote from: realXimpact on November 14, 2012, 12:35 am
I'm surprised no one has brought up a great reason why the 12,000 BTC (about $120,000USD) thing is bunk. It's very simple- That's a laughably small number of BTC compared to the commission made off the whole site's transactions in just one month.

Even JUST using the USA domestic cannabis category for some simple calculations.... I estimate the top vendors move about $2000-5000 of product in a given week based on feedback frequency and checking the item descriptions for those feedback. NCK, Rook, Tweetb and many others crush $2000 a week bare minimum.. So that's an easy $10,000 a week for 5 top vendors, $40,000 in a month. There's dozens more active vendors in just Cannabis alone, I would say even $200,000 from all domestic cannabis vendors in a month is a very VERY low number. Commission is somewhere in between 6-10%, and 10% off that $200k is $20,000 in a month for commission.

Then factor in that there's dozens of drug/other categories and vendors all over the world, custom and private listings, and people that don't leave feedback... that $20,000 from cannabis seems very small. Taking 12k BTC lump sum against a constant and cumulative commission rate like that is just financially retarded.

edit- 120k to 12k BTC in the last line.

EVEN IF YOU ARE ONLY 50% CORRECT, AND THEIR INCOME FROM SR IS ONLY $10,000 per month.....THERE IS NO EXCUSE FOR WEEKS OF A FUCKED UP SITE!!!!  IF YOU HAVE CASH LIKE THAT, THIS SHIT SHOULD BE FIXED IN A DAY!!!  AND DON"T GIVE ME ANY OF THAT "ITS SO COMPLICATED" BULLSHIT.......SILK ROAD IS A TINY, BABY, PUSSY LITTLE WEBSITE IN INTERNET-LAND.....THESE FUCKERS ARE IDIOTS IF THEY HAVEN"T GOT THE SITE UP YET.......AND........IF IT EVER DOES COME BACK UP< IT BETTER BE LIGHTNING FUCKING FAST AND SUCKING OUR DICKS !    I AM STILL TIRED OF THIS BULLSHIT!!!!

Fuckin eh!   >:(

I doubt Limetless will be replying to me after dishing out his verbal assault, which is fine. I consider it an important milestone in any SR users' voyage to get chewed out by Lim, he doesn't just go after any asshole troll on here. I feel special now. <3

But, I'm guessing that you also found it disrespectful to ask a vendor for a ballpark estimate on weekly sales, which is fine. I don't deny that it can be considered rude, but the context of my question has been left out. I made a hypothetical situation a few pages back to give people a scope on the ridiculous amount of commission SR makes to de-bunk the '12k btc is gone omg dpr is stealing from us' theory. I just was looking for an estimate to see if my numbers were close. Doesn't really matter either way, really; I still stand by my modest estimates in that post. NCK also replied with basically "$0 this week" to which I essentially said "lol that's a good answer" Don't worry guys, he can handle himself here!

I don't think it's anyone's business to have any idea how much money someone makes, be it on SR or in real life. You can guesstimate based on prices and the product rotation how much money someone actually makes here. There's no need to ask. It was already stated earlier that for marijuana alone, monthly income is estimated around 100 or 200k or so.

I don't know if you're a vendor or not, but if you are, would you feel comfortable talking about your earnings? I sure wouldn't.

Yes, you're right, no one has the right to know how much a vendor makes. That's not what I asked, though. I politely asked if he would be comfortable giving an estimate, to see how close my estimates were. I used those exact criteria to make my estimations, which is also my post that you're referring to. People are missing the connection of the context beforehand and think I am blindly asking how much NCK profits. Which is completely fine given how much of a clusterfuck this thread is.

I believe a fellow vendor asking that question would be more out of line, but I've had dozens of people ask how much I make on eBay, mostly in disbelief that my entire income comes from there. Rude, yes,but I didn't have to answer. Neither did NCK.
Title: Re: update
Post by: kipperdore on November 14, 2012, 04:27 am
all these words of people griping and whining don't really matter. if this shit works for you - vendor or buyer - you keep on. all in. you can't build up some model SR in your head where everything works great, build your business model off that, and plod forward on the assumption that your imaginary SR will do exactly as you wish. there are unknowns. the unknowns over the course of a year have been, believe it or not, somewhat consistent. it's not all butter, there are some hairs in the food too. take that shit and add it to your conception of reality, and then base your plans and decisions off of it, all the while knowing that any fucking minute could throw you a new monkey wrench. if you try and model your imaginary universe off of this or that sliver of time and experience your imagination will fill in the void and take you places you never wanted to go. stick to the facts, stick to reality, quit making assumptions, and take it or leave it.

Title: Fixing Software Takes Time
Post by: jarrod on November 14, 2012, 05:08 am
I also have a 15+ years of software development, and agree that sometimes it takes far longer than you think to get software problems fixed. Especially when you're dealing with things like sudden, large, increases in user volume. Add on top of that the fact that your site needs to be iron-tight and completely anonymous, and it may take a while to fix problems. On normal websites if you mess up you get fired. Here if you mess up on security you get life in prison. So you have to be careful, and people should respect that!

What gets me nervous is when the site is down this long they may be having other problems like data loss. Maybe they lost account data (ie. your bitcoins) or other transactional data. I really hope they didn't considering I have 40+ bc attached to my account at the moment....

Title: Re: update
Post by: berndi on November 14, 2012, 05:47 am
It is fairly easy to see what is happening. DPR decided, some time ago, that he made enough money (which he certainly has). So why take the risk of operating the site? Of course, he couldn't just shut down the Road because BTC prices would fall and LE would be tracking his endeavors of cashing out. Instead, he faked a "server crash" and "maintenance mode" so he could cash out the BTC in relaxation (just look at the huge movements of BTC documented in this thread). This process takes several days, if not weeks, and that is the cause why the Road is still in maintenance mode. You'll see that when DPR is finished getting his cash, SR and the forums will simply cease to exist.
You heard it here first.

Title: Re: update
Post by: DaMan on November 14, 2012, 06:18 am
BMR isn't quite a SR copy, just of the same role of business. As expected they look alike.
I was remembering when I first saw backopy, was at bitcointalk, back on the early days of SR. He was selling some cracked games or shit like that, when the shit hit the fan at SR with the gawker article and, like now, it went down for quite sometime. I recall this guy, unknown to the community up to so far, just much later he said to be the TD creator as well, to say something like "I'll see what I can do" and overnight he came up with BM (at the time wasn't Reloaded). It surely missed many SR features, was miles away of a carbon copy, more like eBay, you could purchase now and pay after, I may say a total fiasco. With time however it came to be more close to SR business model and v3 was a major improvement.

Title: Re: update
Post by: iamonion on November 14, 2012, 06:59 am
Holy fuck you are seriously lack an understanding of what the feds like to call op-sec.  That stands for operation security.  You CAN NOT and DO NOT EVER display/post/give out information that will give the enemy ideas of what your current plan of attack is.  That means, no updates on why the server is down, no updates on what specifically is being done, no spot on ETA for the server to be up, etc.  You cannot maintain operational security by giving the enemy information of your current whereabouts.  Holy fucking beejesus this is op-sec 101.

Considering how fucking ignorant so many people are to the ideas of security DESPITE USING A WEBSITE THAT ALLOWS THEM TO PURCHASE DRUGS ONLINE... I truly wonder... If SR does get popped how many of you fucking idiots are going down with it for complete and utter failure to understand basic security measures?  I bet 95% of the users here participate in near zero security measures.  I also bet that using even 25% of available security features would be enough to prevent the feds from doing any more than an initial questioning especially if one was to ask for a lawyer and answer nothing... but considering you're all fucking retarded when it comes to security measures... I hope you have fun being pounded by leeroy.

BTW, I just checked the blockchain and my coin hasn't moved.

Title: Re: update
Post by: ralph123 on November 14, 2012, 07:51 am
Quote from: Dread Pirate Roberts on November 12, 2012, 02:15 am
UPDATE (0012 UTC):  Sorry I'm late on this update, won't happen again.  We're pretty much polishing and going down the final check list at this point.  I'm confident we'll make our "matter of days" estimate and this won't be drawn out into week+ territory (assuming nothing goes wrong when we reopen).  When we reopen, access will be limited to vendors only for a few hours so they can mark packages shipped that were sent but not marked before we went down.  Also, auto-finalize and auto-vacation haven't been running since Sunday, and we won't fire those back up for a couple of days after we reopen so everyone can get square first.  Can't wait till this is behind us :)  Next update before 1500 UTC Wednesday.



I have faith in you guys and I know you'll have things back better than ever. Thank you all for your dedication to making Silk Road a great place for everyone. I love you guys

Post by: Vr00mVr0om on November 14, 2012, 08:59 am
back up, and for those who cant read previous posts, only vendors can login now, everyone else will be able to in a few hours....now that everyone can unwad their panties... i found this and it made me chuckle. "conspiracy theorists" would love it.

"A pirate of near-mythical reputation, The Dread Pirate Roberts is feared across the seven seas for his ruthlessness and swordfighting prowess, and is well known for taking no prisoners.
It is revealed during the course of the story that Roberts is not one man, but a series of individuals who periodically pass the name and reputation to a chosen successor. Everyone except the successor and the former Roberts is then released at a convenient port, and a new crew is hired. The former Roberts stays aboard as first mate, referring to his successor as "Captain Roberts", and thereby establishing the new Roberts' persona. After the crew is convinced, the former Roberts leaves the ship and retires on his earnings."

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dread_Pirate_Roberts
(clearnet)

Post by: PartTimeFiend on November 14, 2012, 09:01 am
Based on DPRs last update, it sounds like we're getting closer...

Cannot believe the stressed out people on this thread.  If you read this latest msg, it explains ONLY vendors will be able to access the SR for the first phase of the re-launch, to allow them to catch up.  Encouraging to see the login screen back up though!

I transferred some coins to my SR wallet right before it went down, so as eager as anyone to get back in and place my order.

Cheers
PTF

UPDATE (0012 UTC):  Sorry I'm late on this update, won't happen again.  We're pretty much polishing and going down the final check list at this point.  I'm confident we'll make our "matter of days" estimate and this won't be drawn out into week+ territory (assuming nothing goes wrong when we reopen).  When we reopen, access will be limited to vendors only for a few hours so they can mark packages shipped that were sent but not marked before we went down.  Also, auto-finalize and auto-vacation haven't been running since Sunday, and we won't fire those back up for a couple of days after we reopen so everyone can get square first.  Can't wait till this is behind us :)  Next update before 1500 UTC Wednesday.

UPDATE(0850 UTC): Silk Road is available once again, but on a limited basis.  New user registrations are closed for the time being.  Access is limited to vendors only.  New deposits and withdrawals (and any that were sent just before or during the outage) will not be processed until some time in the next 24 hours.  Assuming all goes well, access for all current members will be made available some time in the next 24 hours.

 ;D ;D Woop! Woop! Thanks to the whole SR team for getting this back up and running fairy quickly,  I've only been a user a short while but my couple of orders I've done (painlessly) have made the site invaluable to me since I moved away from all my irl contacts.  Also thanks to everyone who contributed to this thread (even the haters) it has really kept me entertained over the last few days.

Right I'm off to get some BTC in eager anticipation of being able to purchase some greenery.   ; 8)

KGB

Title: Thank you for letting me spend my money on Silk Road.
Post by: Perrey on November 14, 2012, 02:55 pm
Can someone explain to me why we should pray to/and worship DPR for doing his job? He is fantastic indeed but this is a business and not a club - whats it about? Friendship? NO - money money money.

In this club.. sorry community it seems like we, the buyers, has to be so thankful and happy/satisfied that we even got the chance to be members of this fantastic website (don't take me wrong here - it is fantastic) even though we deposit our hard-earned money that someone will get in return of sending me a product that I want - and I expect that product and nothing else because I am paying for it. It happens every now and then that a vendor might be nice and give you a sample for free but that doesn't mean it will happen again. Business.

Look at the feedback and compare it to forum posts about the same product - (its not only me bringing this up to the table - the newly published research paper on SR mentions it as well  (the paper was published 2-3 weeks ago) they found that even if the product/service wasn't considered to be a perfect 5/5 they still report it to be - sometimes because the vendor sometimes has the power to stop selling to you and or damage your reputation as a buyer/consumer. Many buyers also feel like they have to give a 5/5 and at the same time be thankful that you got the opportunity to buy it in the first place.  I understand that many people thinks that it was worth it no matter what because its illegal and i agree that you can't expect the same from SR as from a legit shop but SR and the vendors are there for one reason - make money.

A bit messy but i hope you get my point..

All the best,
PERREY

In this club.. sorry community it seems like we, the buyers, has to be so thankful and happy/satisfied that we even got the chance to be members of this fantastic website (don't take me wrong here - it is fantastic) even though we deposit our hard-earned money that someone will get in return of sending me a product that I want - and I expect that product and nothing else because I am paying for it. It happens every now and then that a vendor might be nice and give you a sample for free but that doesn't mean it will happen again. Business.

Look at the feedback and compare it to forum posts about the same product - (its not only me bringing this up to the table - the newly published research paper on SR mentions it as well  (the paper was published 2-3 weeks ago) they found that even if the product/service wasn't considered to be a perfect 5/5 they still report it to be - sometimes because the vendor sometimes has the power to stop selling to you and or damage your reputation as a buyer/consumer. Many buyers also feel like they have to give a 5/5 and at the same time be thankful that you got the opportunity to buy it in the first place.  I understand that many people thinks that it was worth it no matter what because its illegal and i agree that you can't expect the same from SR as from a legit shop but SR and the vendors are there for one reason - make money.

A bit messy but i hope you get my point..

All the best,
PERREY

I take your point man for sure.

I think the praise comes from a platform that takes out a lot of the shit that is involved with buying drug IRL.

It all stems from that, I for one am  grateful the platform exists and I don't have to put up with:
- Unreliable Dealers
- Absolute Dog Shit Product

Sure you get the odd scammer here and there, but the difference of buying IRL and here is night and day...

Title: Re: update
Post by: snuff2829 on November 14, 2012, 03:03 pm
Fantastic work getting the site back up!!!

I followed the forums this week, in part to snuff out my own anxiety, but also they have been a very interesting read and study of human nature!  One thing for sure, there are very combustible ingredients here, both of which have been and can be a cause of duress.  One is of course the reason we all are here, and the other is just plain money.  Of course I can't propose a better system, I don't know of one.  But addressing this problem alone, this quote from Romeo fits very well: 

"There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,
Doing more murders in this loathsome world,
Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.
I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.
Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.
Come, cordial and not poison, go with me
. . . for there must I use thee.

Well, either one of these ingredients causes problems, at this point in time, but one matter remains obvious to me is that people need to learn and be patient and have little faith.  There are going to be some losses, and some gains.  Hopefully, on the timeline of infinity, this one instance will help.  I respect DPR very much for the undertaking here!  and for the patience and the wisdom and strength of character DPR continues to display.  Thanks!!

Title: Re: update
Post by: UnbekannterAffe on November 14, 2012, 11:21 pm
congrats SR-team for getting the site back online...!!! i'm an IT-admin myself  and i think i can imagine what you went through the last days. not sure, what infrastructure this whole thing is based on, but outages like this always remind you that in order to achieve a maximum availability you need redundancy pretty much on every level (storage, network, server (incl. web-server, database-server, etc.) , switches, routers, cabling, power). of course a professional provider can provide that, but this platform is not something you run with professional provider like amazon or google. ;)

i guess you will have a proper analysis of the whole thing to be able to improve the potential weak spots in your infrastructure.

talking about infrastructure, is there some information available about what your infrastructure looks like or is based on? just curious, comes with the job.

about the bitcoins-transfers:
not sure, but since processing is currently halted, i would expect that any new incoming coins will just be queued and will be transferred, once the processing starts again. well, can't be sure though. i for myself will not transfer coins until tomorrow morning.

again, THANKS SR-team for bringing the site back online. live long and prosper...

Title: Re: update
Post by: rabbit88 on November 15, 2012, 03:09 am
Quote from: MeatMittens on November 15, 2012, 02:55 am
Just a heads up for people wanting to place orders:

It took me about an hour and a half of trying but my order finally went through. Almost instantly my vendor replied and said he received the order and thanked me for the purchase. Good luck everyone with your orders.  :D


Yes it is trick getting SR to work --- seems like the issue is too many MySQL queries making the server temporarily unresponsive at times. Have seen this quite a bit in my IT travels.  .. For me a fresh boot before entering tor network helps. Then using a lot of back buttons to last successful cached page -  then refreshing my network connection before clicking on link or submitting data. On Linux there is the auto eth0 button at top which is like resetting the adapter on windows machine this has helped a lot. 

But really really happy to have site back and don't mind the minor tech bugs ...

if he did do it, it would take him 10 years before he could cash it all out.

Title: Re: update
Post by: citizen erased on November 15, 2012, 09:16 am

This is very true. Though the darknet operates different to the clearweb the principals behind the server should still be the same and every time you try to retry and refresh you're screen you are sending a new request and usually the old request is still being processed on the server side.

I'm not 100% sure how much of a difference it makes but it definately doesn't help if everyone pounds the refresh button in panic. It's almost like a rush on the bank causing inflation.

i would like to think that in such a situation DPR would pay him off rather than expose his users anyway. sort of been saying this all along but now that i have no SR, i'll take the time to spell things out:
- DPR/SR would never scam their users, that is a stupid theory, we're the geese laying golden eggs for them
- if only one person can restart the system, they're not going to a beach for a holiday without at least a smartphone
- you don't put a production site out of action for this long for upgrades, there are many release processes that'll switch from the old code to new without bringing the site down at all.
- the only reason you would keep a production site down for this long is for security breaches you haven't fixed yet (or someone else is keeping it down for you)


could be wrong but makes more sense than the rest of the doom theories going on.

Heres the big tip. Dont leave your coins in your SR account (until this shit has been sorted) and change your password to something that isnt close to being in the dictionary.

Then leave it to denial-of-service boy to keep trying his PHP shit on the site until they patch it.

PS, dos boy, post a single cracked hash. Please, it will make me firm to see what algorithm you craced with your awesome power.
Title: Re: update

are the security issues for buyers  (always send addresses PGP encryptet). ?

tia br sweet

worst case scenario someone shuts down SR and we all move on either to something else or forget about it and DPR will left to clean up the mess.

security issues for buyers and sellers should be absolute minimal. from what i gather the address box is stored encrypted in the database, and it should be sent by PGP anyway.

The only thing you could incriminate yourself with is through the private messages as they don't look like they're encrypted.

IP's are fine as they are through the TOR network and i would be VERY surprised if these are logged in the database anyway....

BUT this is absolute worst case. Personal opinion is this guy is just taking advantage and sending panic around.

I guess we'll see.

As you said he won't have any cracked passwords. The hash he displayed was a sha512 password.

Assuming DPR set the site up with a salt added to user passwords (no one would run a site like this without using a salt on password hashes) then there is no way this guy can crack a sha512.

IF this guy is the one behind you're most likely right that a DDOS attack. that's IF.
Title: Re: update
Post by: citizen erased on November 15, 2012, 10:39 am
Quote from: bincofone on November 15, 2012, 10:33 am
Someone could just be sending the hash of a known password i.e. the hash of the password of their own account. Until they've responded to DPR with the requested users hash, they're full of shit.

that wouldn't matter.

the passwords would (at least SHOULD) have a salt attached to them which is just a bunch of random characters that not even the user knows. This prevents dictionary and rainbow attacks on passwords.

but they could just be sending a hash of anything random.... it could be 123456 for all we know. i can't be fucked checking.

if you search through the hidden wiki there are hacking sites and they have dictionaries of known hashes and it's possible the hash he stated in his first post is on them....

Title: Re: update
Post by: bincofone on November 15, 2012, 01:12 pm
Quote
Is it possible for someone to set up a  copy of the SILKROAD HIDDEN SERVICE: same adress: http://silkroadvb5piz3r.onion - and then just collect user:password
Terrible if its so easy to do this but how can the system protect from such an attack?

Your Tor hidden service URL is like a public key.

There are 43608742899428874059776 different urls you can randomly generate a key to host a Tor hidden service at. Half of that number is how many key generations you'd have to try on average before finding a key suitable for any particular URL.

Possible, but ridiculously unlikely.

Sorry, but it's obvious that it is a little bit more than "some downtime". I think it is neither parnaoia nor conspiracy theory to assume, that SR is under attack. It's just logical deduction.

Got anything to back up your 'logical deduction' ?

Other than an illogical assumption of course.

Of course I got, my back up is just experience. What is going up with SR since almost a week is definetley not just a "Scheduled Maintenance", everyone can see, that they have really big problems to keep the site on and stable. And an attack as a reason for those problems is not such irrational.

Title: Re: update
Post by: HeadacheHealer on November 15, 2012, 01:28 pm
shook: those are false.

DPR:  IDEA!  Have SR's onion address just access the login page, on a VM or server separate from the rest of the website but still with access.  Upon login, check credentials, and see if the user is either a vendor or a buyer with outstanding orders, and if so, forward them off to a separate temporary server with different resources, that way people hammering the login page or who aren't qualified, or if someone is DDoS'ing the site (over TOR? hmmm seems unlikely without us observing it in network traffic from key nodes!), well, then they wouldn't have the active / real url 'less they were one of the above user types.

Title: Re: update
Post by: jagfug on November 15, 2012, 01:55 pm
Remember when Dread said they had to sleep and would get back on it? Well they did, didn't they? and it worked, and they probably are just waking up to this now.

Time will tell.

Everything was back up for buyers, with outstanding, and finalization orders pending, I was able to leave feedback, release funds, even placed a new order. By the time Europe started falling asleep, it got super fast! I had 5-6 screens going in seperate windows, and under 5 second load times. Then around 3am NY time, so like UK, Germany, etc, that was your "wake up" time, and those in earlier time zones, India, etc, were getting on. It started to get real slow real fast, and then Kaput! - Overloaded servers.

The conspiracy theorists came out of the woodwork with newbie accounts mostly, I mean you'd be crazy not to have at least a 1% possiblity that it was something other than the "rush hour" effect. Too many cars, and not enough lanes to carry them all. Backups, gridlock (NYC term when the entire intersections lock up).

Take a "wait + see" attitude. - Then again, I only stand to lose a few hundred. I don't have the luxury of knowing what it's like to have 500 btc's or more. That is a the gamble you take on here. Some are higher rollers than others.

I have a gut feeling, it will come back. I mean last night (8 hours ago) - It was like the good old days, and I had forgotten all about the stoppage. You'll see, it will come back. Much more money to be made.

"You gotta know when to hold 'em. Know when to fold 'em" - as the song goes. It is by far too early in this game for the casino to close.

Lot's of servers used worldwide are centered in the financial district of NYC, some of which is still flooded from Hurricane Sandy, so there are a lot of things to take into account. DPR is not just going to come out and share that, I know, because I installed many of them after 9/11. Not an IT pro, just a technician, but I learned a lot that Fall+Winter of 2001, and how bandwith is sold, at night for instance when the NYSE is closed, those servers are humming away like it's opening bell and Apple just announced it's new flying car!

Lot's of forces at work here people. Kind of have to look from "outside of the box" - to use an annoying corporate cliche. Keep the faith!

I'll bet BlackMarket Reloaded is making a killing off this outtage  - Maybe it's the same guys! It's set up almost exactly the same. Just has a different appearance.

OH well. later people

Post by: mnak on November 15, 2012, 04:08 pm

Quote from: trc on November 15, 2012, 03:23 pm
Captcha should be an option, if you have a complex password thats 16+ characters with numbers letters symbols and capitols you would be dead before any one could crack it.

jesus this has nothing to do with passwords, its has to do with pc load time of captchas,  thanks for your brilliant input though, really 16+ digit passwords are good? no way!
His statement makes sense.  The capcha protects against brute force password attacks.  Having a long password makes such attacks drastically less feasible.

Title: Re: update
Post by: Joy on November 15, 2012, 06:02 pm
Quote from: Dread Pirate Roberts on November 13, 2012, 04:18 am
Hey gang,

We're still getting things set up.  Nothing new to report.  Obviously I can't say much, but we are redeploying the entire system and it is taking lots of time to get all of the data properly backed up and where it needs to be, not to mention thoroughly testing the changes we are making to the system that will hopefully give us enough head room to grow multiple times again.

I'm fully aware that Silk Road isn't your only choice and that my reputation is on the line right now.  We are working on all of these issues in parallel and will be slamming the caffeine until we are up and stable.

Your next update will come no later than 5 am EST.

Cheers,
DPR

PS - I hear everyone's hopes and fears.  This is a stressful time for some of us.  I'm taking this opportunity to find a calm center as the situation whirls around me and I keep pressing forward, calm and clear.  This won't be the most challenging situation I'll face I am sure and it is good practice.  Good luck to each of you as you get through this with me :)

Wish you all the good luck mate. 8)

Title: Re: update
Post by: jesse on November 15, 2012, 11:02 pm
I'm a vendor...
When reading the posts I wonder...why the admiration for DPR?
 He is just someone who made a website like many did before (e bay, amazon and many local selling sites as we all know)...but for drugs.
Having at least 25 million dollar of sales a year and the commission coming from that makes a real good income I think.
That is why I think it is only normal to keep the site working properly...vendors pay an amount of bitcoins (35 I think it was) and !!commission (buyer and vendors) with every sale to even get the chance of selling.
I get the idea that people are thankful for this....we are just providing income for the founders.....
I'm happy that it is working again but seeing what i payed in commission and fees its not more than normal....I PAYED FOR IT RIGHT ?
There are more sites like this ...blackmarket reloaded as example is almost the same.
Again, as a vendor I pay enough..... I need quality..at least an explanation  when it goes wrong....
Yes I am happy that it is working but also angry not getting an update why ''my'' site  (I am one of many who keep this alive) is not working properly

Title: Re: update
Post by: opieradio on November 16, 2012, 12:53 am
Quote from: Dread Pirate Roberts on November 12, 2012, 02:15 am
UPDATE (2326 UTC 11/15/2012): Might not have to take the site down after all.  I'll let you know here if we do.  A side note about withdrawals:  There have been a ton of them (understandable), so we are getting through them as fast as possible.  Please be patient if we haven't gotten to yours yet.

UPDATE (2254 UTC 11/15/2012): The site went down again and there are people claiming to be responsible for it and making threats.  I don't want to take any chances, so the site is going to come down for a bit while we investigate what is going on.  Hopefully this is short lived... what drama!  Next update will come before 0600 UTC.

UPDATE (2355 UTC): Deposits are working.  All outstanding deposits have been processed, and future deposits will be processed as usual.  If you sent a deposit before or during the outage and your account has not been credited, message support so we can investigate your issue.  Some withdrawals have been processed, but there is still a queue we are working through.  I'll update when withdrawals are back to normal.

UPDATE (2052 UTC): Current members now have full access to Silk Road.  Registrations are still closed until we are certain we can handle the additional traffic.  We are still unable to process deposits and withdrawals, but are getting very close.  I will start a new thread with some commentary on this whole situation once we are running 100%.

UPDATE(0850 UTC): Silk Road is available once again, but on a limited basis.  New user registrations are closed for the time being.  Access is limited to vendors only.  New deposits and withdrawals (and any that were sent just before or during the outage) will not be processed until some time in the next 24 hours.  Assuming all goes well, access for all current members will be made available some time in the next 24 hours.

UPDATE (0012 UTC):  Sorry I'm late on this update, won't happen again.  We're pretty much polishing and going down the final check list at this point.  I'm confident we'll make our "matter of days" estimate and this won't be drawn out into week+ territory (assuming nothing goes wrong when we reopen).  When we reopen, access will be limited to vendors only for a few hours so they can mark packages shipped that were sent but not marked before we went down.  Also, auto-finalize and auto-vacation haven't been running since Sunday, and we won't fire those back up for a couple of days after we reopen so everyone can get square first.  Can't wait till this is behind us :)  Next update before 1500 UTC Wednesday.

UPDATE (1113 UTC): I and the team need sleep.  Getting really close now, home stretch (hopefully).  Next update will come before 2300 UTC, Tuesday.

UPDATE (0924 UTC): I know you won't like hearing this, but we aren't quite there yet.  We are working hard and getting closer though.  Next update will come before 1600 UTC.

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hello everyone,

I'm alive, I'm safe.  Luck would have it that the first time I'm away for more than 24 hours, the site goes down and I'm the only one that can bring it back up.  As soon as we are sure there haven't been any security breaches and taken all of the necessary precautions, we will get back up and running.  If anyone's orders get messed up because of this (auto-finalizing, etc), we will take full responsibility and make things right, just contact support once we're back up.  I'm terribly sorry for this and all of the recent problems.  I promise it is my top priority to get things running smoothly again.

- -DPR
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.11 (GNU/Linux)

Quote from: Dread Pirate Roberts on November 12, 2012, 02:15 am
UPDATE (2326 UTC 11/15/2012): Might not have to take the site down after all.  I'll let you know here if we do.  A side note about withdrawals:  There have been a ton of them (understandable), so we are getting through them as fast as possible.  Please be patient if we haven't gotten to yours yet.

UPDATE (2254 UTC 11/15/2012): The site went down again and there are people claiming to be responsible for it and making threats.  I don't want to take any chances, so the site is going to come down for a bit while we investigate what is going on.  Hopefully this is short lived... what drama!  Next update will come before 0600 UTC.

UPDATE (2355 UTC): Deposits are working.  All outstanding deposits have been processed, and future deposits will be processed as usual.  If you sent a deposit before or during the outage and your account has not been credited, message support so we can investigate your issue.  Some withdrawals have been processed, but there is still a queue we are working through.  I'll update when withdrawals are back to normal.

UPDATE (2052 UTC): Current members now have full access to Silk Road.  Registrations are still closed until we are certain we can handle the additional traffic.  We are still unable to process deposits and withdrawals, but are getting very close.  I will start a new thread with some commentary on this whole situation once we are running 100%.

UPDATE(0850 UTC): Silk Road is available once again, but on a limited basis.  New user registrations are closed for the time being.  Access is limited to vendors only.  New deposits and withdrawals (and any that were sent just before or during the outage) will not be processed until some time in the next 24 hours.  Assuming all goes well, access for all current members will be made available some time in the next 24 hours.

UPDATE (0012 UTC):  Sorry I'm late on this update, won't happen again.  We're pretty much polishing and going down the final check list at this point.  I'm confident we'll make our "matter of days" estimate and this won't be drawn out into week+ territory (assuming nothing goes wrong when we reopen).  When we reopen, access will be limited to vendors only for a few hours so they can mark packages shipped that were sent but not marked before we went down.  Also, auto-finalize and auto-vacation haven't been running since Sunday, and we won't fire those back up for a couple of days after we reopen so everyone can get square first.  Can't wait till this is behind us :)  Next update before 1500 UTC Wednesday.

UPDATE (1113 UTC): I and the team need sleep.  Getting really close now, home stretch (hopefully).  Next update will come before 2300 UTC, Tuesday.

UPDATE (0924 UTC): I know you won't like hearing this, but we aren't quite there yet.  We are working hard and getting closer though.  Next update will come before 1600 UTC.

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hello everyone,

I'm alive, I'm safe.  Luck would have it that the first time I'm away for more than 24 hours, the site goes down and I'm the only one that can bring it back up.  As soon as we are sure there haven't been any security breaches and taken all of the necessary precautions, we will get back up and running.  If anyone's orders get messed up because of this (auto-finalizing, etc), we will take full responsibility and make things right, just contact support once we're back up.  I'm terribly sorry for this and all of the recent problems.  I promise it is my top priority to get things running smoothly again.

- -DPR
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.11 (GNU/Linux)

Hello everyone,

- -DPR

Hash: SHA1

Hello everyone,

I'm alive, I'm safe.  Luck would have it that the first time I'm away for more than 24 hours, the site goes down and I'm the only one that can bring it back up.  As soon as we are sure there haven't been any security breaches and taken all of the necessary precautions, we will get back up and running.  If anyone's orders get messed up because of this (auto-finalizing, etc), we will take full responsibility and make things right, just contact support once we're back up.  I'm terribly sorry for this and all of the recent problems.  I promise it is my top priority to get things running smoothly again.

- -DPR

Hello everyone,

I'm alive, I'm safe.  Luck would have it that the first time I'm away for more than 24 hours, the site goes down and I'm the only one that can bring it back up.  As soon as we are sure there haven't been any security breaches and taken all of the necessary precautions, we will get back up and running.  If anyone's orders get messed up because of this (auto-finalizing, etc), we will take full responsibility and make things right, just contact support once we're back up.  I'm terribly sorry for this and all of the recent problems.  I promise it is my top priority to get things running smoothly again.

- -DPR

Title: Re: update
Post by: dopey on November 16, 2012, 04:58 am
Dear SR boys n girls,
Things are working their way out and thats great. Current members are slowly getting things going. Im waiting for a different kind of update: when can I sign up for a new account? Im not your normal situation. How many vendors are losing sales because new members who have been waiting to sign up are looking more and more at other options. Before anyone goes off on loyalty to SR I think judging by this last "situation" (what does your dealer usually tell you? A "situation" came up but I will come through) people behave as they do in the streets when it comes down to it. This is business and where as there are always going to be pros and cons (security included) there will (just like the street) always be those other guys you call when you cant reach your normal hookup. How many loyal SR users found themselves browsing other sites more during this time? How much more did business increase for other sites? DPR has been losing money during this "situation". Im sure its alot so I know his best interest is in getting things going. Not to mention the stress has got to be just as bad as it is for some of the members on this board during this time. Just in a different way. Bravo on not getting caught up in it. So im not trying to be a hammer on anyone I just want to make it loud and clear that there are new users still waiting to sign up. My significant other gets the account we used together (I got the dog!) so before anyone makes too big of an assumption about me I have been here just like you. I didnt lose any BTC or anything but I have been waiting and reading just like the rest. Starting over has alot of complications for a buyer just think about it. I will NOT mention the other name either-to anyone. We are 2 seperate individuals with seperate habits and behaviors. I do not want to be associated with that account or person. So I figure now that I have addressed a larger scope of the "situation" and have brought perspectives to other users "situations" that maybe I can get DPR to notice my comment and mention whats up in an update (thats what IM waiting for) or maybe a fellow user has an idea im not aware of. I will NOT buy someone elses account. Im not going to even say anything about that.
Love and kisses.
-El Dopo the DwaRf with One eYe

I will return doing my thing here when I see fit.
