Title: Re: update
Post by: nomad bloodbath on November 16, 2012, 08:33 am
Quote from: JezuzWazaMushroom on November 16, 2012, 08:25 am
Quote from: theswampmonster on November 16, 2012, 07:55 am
Anyone else having issues with bitinstant to SR bitcoin address deposits?  I deposited cash 9 hours ago at Walmart and I'm still waiting to see the bitcoins in my account.  I e-mail support.  Hopefully I get the bit coins soon.  Going to bed nervous in hopes support responds and helps me out.

I deposited on the 10th and on the 14th my money from my SR account was removed through the block chain to unknown places. I contacted SR who asked me for the deposit address I sent it to, which I gave them, and then now it's been over 24hrs and I've heard nothing and to add insult to injury, I cahane my password, log in once with the new one, and now it doesn't recognise me at all.

I had to log in with my new account but at the moment I'm 150BTC out of pocket and I'm too scared to deposit more into my second one I was saving to become a vendor account or the one I can't get access to.

Need help asap any ADMIN guys!!!

You ever heard of the Phrase:
"Pics or it didnt happen."


Show me the proof.

X)

Title: Re: update
Post by: dopey on November 16, 2012, 08:55 am
Donnyberger-
Im just curious but why would DPR want to block new registrations? If even more people are trying to get on isnt that a good thing? Do we (you) not want anymore users in SR or is it full? So the vendors that are there can have the existing buyers only. As time goes on and vendors fade away does DPR open it up to just new vendors? As well as you are restricting vendors to the existing members only. Where will new registers go? Thats where the vendors will follow to and SR will lose out on all of that business. When you say "a way to block all these morons" I assume you are refering to all the current members who flipped out while SR was down? Both vendors and buyers. As well as you must be refering to the existing members that are trying to scam for BTCs. Has nothing to do with new registers. I think the bottom line is you have an account and its working and thats all you are thinking about. Also if you consider the site going down and having its members freaking out about being ripped off is limelight I question your thinking all together. If anything it made members pull their BTCs out and others steer clear but thats what you would have anyway. New registers they wernt here when you were so by seniority that makes you superior. I have met people like that. They usually wont help other users (definately not newbies) and look at themselves as privlidged for "being there first" although they are just another one of the masses. Its easy to call others behaviors obnoxious when you have no investment in the object that is at risk. I would like to see (although I can predict) how you would behave if the situation was different. If you had a large amount of BTC or maybe someone elses tied up. Maybe you can afford to juggle the money around but not everyone can. Im not saying everyones reactions were sensible but there is a justifiable reason to be worried and for that and combined with their different characters and the variables of their addiction as well as their financial state--I understand as I think DPR does. Thus the reason he has handled this professionaly and not got caught up in the commotion. Everyone understands the risk and I dont think there is anyone who doesnt thank DPR and everyone else that contributes to what makes this all work (its not just DPR) but at the same time these people are also contributing to the community that is at the heart of this. They pay their fees and follow the rules. These people make the system possible and in that respect and in this particular case forgiveness and understanding should be at the top of everyones list right now. Then there is the other foot that you can try my shoe on: im a SR member who split with their significant other. I need to start an account of my own now. I have been waiting just like you. Should I be "halted" from registering a new account? What if it was you that just found SR like some of the new registers have. You remember how excited you were to see it? Well you cant join because your new. Hopefully you can understand where im coming from and you take this the right way. Try not to have a "spazathon" over it. ;)
Title: Re: update
Post by: fat people like sauce and on November 16, 2012, 09:05 am
dopey, why don't you go write your novel over at blackmarket reloaded.

I doubt SR will be taking new registers anytime in the near future, there's just too much on the plate as it is.

What with spam accounts, dumbass teenagers, threat of undercover LE, overall traffic and scamsters.... something that SR administration just doesn't have the time or energy to deal with ATM.

hope you understand.

Well you cant join because your new. Hopefully you can understand where im coming from and you take this the right way. Try not to have a "spazathon" over it. ;)

Well for the time being the site has obvs been struggling so the obvious thing would be to do would be halt new users. Dpr has already commented on the ' explosive growth'
I dont think at the moment SR will lose any buisness.
It was mostly newbies who flipped out but thats my opinion.

Ive only just started as a vendor. after a week of it working out, it was down for a week so yes i can clearly see new ppl registering needs to be halted. I was also a buyer from near the start of SR so i can see how the issue has come about. Im thinking about all the decent vendors and buyers and future registrations. I would rather DPR took time to improve the site instead of allowing new accounts and crashing the site again. You will find the longer serving members didnt panic withdraw BTC's. Im not superior i just want the site to work. I understand there are decent sensible ppl who want to register an account. Im not saying they cant because they are new, im saying not having anyone new register is the sensible thing to do as the site cant handle it right. and a lot of the newbs comments on here arent going to help to persuade DPR to change his mind anytime soon.

This exercise has that you are responsible for every little thing you do on Silk Road and so take a minute to think at every move you make on the darknet should be as if you were playing chess with a competitor and nothing is worth face value.

Barely missed the registration being open huh, I do not think personal issues with your love life are gonna hit a sweet spot in The Staff's hearts to make this one exception. I wished it had been invite only or 1 day a week randomly allowed to control userbase about 7 months ago. Too many abuse the system as it is, but never the less the registration is not closed forever so maybe your personal spazathon should relax down.

These threads are pointless. Registration will be allowed when it is allowed, no one even has a quote on why it is not currently allowed.

Its funny how you are treated in this forum under a different name. I dont think a newbie like yourself would have even commented if I wasnt using this new name. I know your just playing up to the users in this forum that are higher up then you but they are just people. Its a forum and if you have alot of time and HELP people you too can become a hero member. That doesnt mean you are better or that what you say is law. People can be wrong even if they have posted 1000s of postings and are a hero member. Im not some punk kid who just found SR while taking a break from WOW. I put my time in. I paid my dues meaning I have been ripped off in the ever persuit of creating a safer environment on SR. I have contributed to the community by being honest and being a loyal and frequent user. I have been here the same as everyone else. Treat me with respect and I will do the same. Writing novels is easy when you know the words. Hope you understand. If you need more clearification I can write these novels all day n night for you.

Agreed. I get that not being able to register a new a/c must be frustrating, but it's completely understandable given the last week or so of problems.  I wouldn't be surprised if 100's, if not 1000's of new account were being opened every day, and this massive spike in new a/c's may have contributed to the websites problems.  Of course the SR team want to grow the community, but it's gotta be done carefully.
Btw Nomad - I like your idea of 'account by invite only'. +1 karma.  I've only helped friends onto the Road who I know are reliable and trustworthy, and will appreciate this amazing marketplace.
Cheers,

As well as you are restricting vendors to the existing members only. Where will new registers go? Thats where the vendors will follow to and SR will lose out on all of that business. When you say "a way to block all these morons" I assume you are refering to all the current members who flipped out while SR was down? Both vendors and buyers. As well as you must be refering to the existing members that are trying to scam for BTCs. Has nothing to do with new registers. I think the bottom line is you have an account and its working and thats all you are thinking about. Also if you consider the site going down and having its members freaking out about being ripped off is limelight I question your thinking all together. If anything it made members pull their BTCs out and others steer clear but thats what you would have anyway. New registers they wernt here when you were so by seniority that makes you superior. I have met people like that. They usually wont help other users (definately not newbies) and look at themselves as privlidged for "being there first" although they are just another one of the masses. Its easy to call others behaviors obnoxious when you have no investment in the object that is at risk. I would like to see (although I can predict) how you would behave if the situation was different. If you had a large amount of BTC or maybe someone elses tied up. Maybe you can afford to juggle the money around but not everyone can. Im not saying everyones reactions were sensible but there is a justifiable reason to be worried and for that and combined with their different characters and the variables of their addiction as well as their financial state--I understand as I think DPR does. Thus the reason he has handled this professionaly and not got caught up in the commotion. Everyone understands the risk and I dont think there is anyone who doesnt thank DPR and everyone else that contributes to what makes this all work (its not just DPR) but at the same time these people are also contributing to the community that is at the heart of this. They pay their fees and follow the rules. These people make the system possible and in that respect and in this particular case forgiveness and understanding should be at the top of everyones list right now. Then there is the other foot that you can try my shoe on: im a SR member who split with their significant other. I need to start an account of my own now. I have been waiting just like you. Should I be "halted" from registering a new account? What if it was you that just found SR like some of the new registers have. You remember how excited you were to see it? Well you cant join because your new. Hopefully you can understand where im coming from and you take this the right way. Try not to have a "spazathon" over it. ;)

I appreciate the quotation marks on spazathon since it is my use of the word that you now misuse it.
Vendor accounts are more dangerous than buyer accounts. Sorry you lost your SR account access with your gf.bf whatever significant other means to you.
Barely missed the registration being open huh, I do not think personal issues with your love life are gonna hit a sweet spot in The Staff's hearts to make this one exception. I wished it had been invite only or 1 day a week randomly allowed to control userbase about 7 months ago. Too many abuse the system as it is, but never the less the registration is not closed forever so maybe your personal spazathon should relax down.

These threads are pointless. Registration will be allowed when it is allowed, no one even has a quote on why it is not currently allowed.


X)
nomad bloodbath

The term you coined refers to the "situation" that took place here on SR (as I called it). The way I used it was in a sarcastic sense to imply that his reaction was of the same caliber. So I cant see it as being wrong in its use. You say vendor accounts are more dangerous then buyer accounts but based on what? What if im the president of the US? Do you think a vendor would face as much trouble as me? Also vendors have the ability to just drop off a package with no return address or a fake one if they like. Buyers have to recieve the items which is where it is usually caught at. So I think danger is a perspective. Do vendors risk more then buyers in transactions? Thats debateable and depends on different factors but I could see how that could be more dangerous. I got a divorce if you must know and it happens. Im not going to ask for the account from my lawyer. I use SR regularly so this has been a hard time especially for me--so thank you for saying your sorry although I feel it was sarcastic. I say significant other because I am not going to revel jack about myself anywhere if I dont have to. I dont care what anyone says if im vague I feel better. As far as looking for a sweet spot in the the staffs hearts that was never my intention. I am simply the voice that is asking when new registrations will be open and I explained my situation in case there was an alternative. I made sure that I made myself heard hoping that DPR might see it and throw out an update reguarding it. All of my posts have been calm. Never have I asked with pressure or impatience. Determination yes. The sad thing is do you know how many non-scammers contacted me asking if I wanted to buy an account? I say non-scammers because these are long standing members that have vendor accounts. So as far as im concerned this isnt always about community and safety its about money. Money always=greed. So while SR members may think theyre keeping the scammers out by not allowing new registers the members are selling accounts to anyone who will pay enough. Thats BS. No matter what you limit the members to you are going to have scammers its the nature of this business and in the online world. Limiting members isnt going to fix that something else has to be decided but I do understand and agree that something should be done. If there are more users then the system can handle then the thing to do would be expand to meet the market or put implements in place to weed out the scammers or else it will crash like it did/does. Otherwise other sites pop up offering the same things which is what is happening. Now I know that SR is great but other sites can reach this same height with work so its not as if SR will be the only option in years to come. There is a new site being built now that many members of this forum are assisting with so its not a matter of not being loyal to SR its just the way things go. People will always build bigger and bette/safer methods to the ones that are existing. Just to be clear I have not spazzed out or got angry irritated or frustrated at any point. Im able to exist without SR but who wants to do that? These threads have a way of going off on their own tangents so I know nothing is going to be solved here but I bet you DPR will see that new registers are in fact waiting now with these posts and make an announcement in the next update. Thanks for the banter back n forth I think this novel will be my last for today.

So it is hard seeing comments like its so nice....etc. knowing I have to still wait and judging by peoples attitudes I wouldnt get in at all if they had their way. I want to sigh with relief and get in touch with my favorite vendors. I have money but no outlet-yet. I am envious not jealous. I am no different then you. I only ask that you take one second to think about that. Apreciate what you have.

Well for the time being the site has obvs been struggling so the obvious thing would be to do would be halt new users. Dpr has already commented on the ' explosive growth'
I dont think at the moment SR will lose any buisness.
It was mostly newbies who flipped out but thats my opinion.

Ive only just started as a vendor. after a week of it working out, it was down for a week so yes i can clearly see new ppl registering needs to be halted. I was also a buyer from near the start of SR so i can see how the issue has come about. Im thinking about all the decent vendors and buyers and future registrations. I would rather DPR took time to improve the site instead of allowing new accounts and crashing the site again. You will find the longer serving members didnt panic withdraw BTC's. Im not superior i just want the site to work. I understand there are decent sensible ppl who want to register an account. Im not saying they cant because they are new, im saying not having anyone new register is the sensible thing to do as the site cant handle it right. and a lot of the newbs comments on here arent going to help to persuade DPR to change his mind anytime soon.

This is what im talking about. I agree with you in your clearified statement. I understand both sides but your original post came off in a different way or thats how I took it. I always say the problem with textsemails is there is no tone of voice. people shorten their thoughts and misunderstandings happen. Thanks for your professional response. I take back the points in which I thought you were presenting yourself as superior. ;D

This is not a rant or dig at you two i just thought it was relevant to the conversation

From all the retarded comments Ive been reading on this thread it seems that the ones who talk the most bollocks already have SR accounts, they are just new to the forum. I think its not so much about the quantity of customers but the quality of customers. There's been way too many ranting and raving because they might loose a couple of hundred quid. Boo hoo, these are the people who need to be ejected as they obviously have no idea about the drug trade. Id like to see them bitch and moan if they done a deal down a back alley and got a gun in their face and ripped off at the same time. Would they shout "well i don't get treated like this in my local supermarket!" The mugger would probably then shoot them for being so stupid. At least they don't have that fear here thats why they rant and moan and show themselves to be true morons. This is an illicit trade and sometimes shit happens. DON'T TREAT IT LIKE AMAZON!!! SR could be gone at anytime and its forum,then where you gonna go to cry? If you don't have it to loose don't leave it lying around in your SR wallet for convenience ! deposit only when your buying that way if it was to vanish you at least have cut down the damage to you. Maybe a trusted invite system is whats required so only existing members can induct new members rather than just any tom dick or harry getting access. That way at least their is some way of vetting new members and ensuring they are up to speed with the drug trade. Geeze i don't believe Ive had to state the obvious. Some people if they had brains they would be deadly.

Again lads this wasn't aimed at you but the 'community' or lack there of as a whole. Peace and love x

Post by: ph3n0m on November 16, 2012, 01:00 pm
DPR,

    Thank you for all your hard work. Like many others I took things for granted. It's true what hey say: "You don't know what you've got till it's gone". A couple of months ago I was googling around trying to find some place online for pain meds. I stumbled across the Road and thought I'd found heaven. And when that heaven went away for a while I was lost and afraid. Thank you for keeping us updated via this thread. I hung on the edge of my seat for each update. I could tell that you were working very hard to get the Road back up and running. I think that a lot of things were said on the forum as a result of the fear and uncertainty people were feeling. Now I know just how much this place means to me. You are really making a difference in people's lives. Again, I sincerely thank you and your team for all your hard work and effort you put in.  ;)

Sincere Regards,
ph3n0m

If you don't have it to loose don't leave it lying around in your SR wallet for convenience ! deposit only when your buying that way if it was to vanish you at least have cut down the damage to you. Maybe a trusted invite system is whats required so only existing members can induct new members rather than just any tom dick or harry getting access. That way at least their is some way of vetting new members and ensuring they are up to speed with the drug trade. Geeze i don't believe Ive had to state the obvious. Some people if they had brains they would be deadly.

Again lads this wasn't aimed at you but the 'community' or lack there of as a whole. Peace and love x

Some thoughts on what you said-not aimed at attacking you or anything. The people that have been making the most noise arent just new users to the forum. Its not a matter of how long you have been using the forums that determines behaviors especially when we could be talking about addicts. I just think some people reacted diffferently then others and depending on the feedback they recieved it could go one way or the other. Based on what I saw many other members didnt help the situation with their comments. Alot of people dont want to be told they are wrong for fearing their money is gone. They also dont want to be told that this is like a back alley dealer when before this the key focus has been on building a community that runs on trust. Speaking of the the back alley senerio isnt that why we are here anyway? To avoid that sort of situation. To act more as professionals. As far as the quality of the the members goes there will never be a way to get rid of scammers completely. The nature of the business and the online world makes it near impossible to run something like this without having troublemakers. Look at eBay no matter what they implement scammers get in and scam. The quality of user ranges on eBay just like it does here. Again I dont think limiting members will fix this. Membership fees might help weed out some but having invites by current members only means that the current members that are scammers can invite their scammer friends. Members will start selling accounts (like I have been offered) and then your right back where you started Its hard to have a site where you need to protect your identity but be able to verify members are not scammers. Even legit vendors turn into scammers sometimes so you cant be sure about anyone. Think about it.You say not to treat this like Amazon but why not? That is what we all would prefer isnt it? A site that is easy to use and you can buy what you want. Lots of options and lots of content. Maybe some buyer protection? I think you might have meant dont expect it to work like Amazon meaning there are scammers? Because there are scammers on Amazon too. I get the general point that SR is an underground operation and you cant expect it to have the same policys/behaviors that Amazon has but it could run with the same efficentcy (spelling?). The drug trade and back alley dealers are two different types of entities. In truth a professional in the drug trade runs things like a business and has many of the same practices that we use on SR. Where as a back alley dealer is someone who is usually an addict themselves who sells to support their own habit and that means your going to get screwed around. Many of us have been at this for MANY years working and suffering our way through these people to get to the professionals. We remember the back alley dealers though and that could be partially why some members flipped out. People have become acustomed to trusting SR not just their favorite vendors and when it looked like they wernt getting the response they wanted out of DPR it brought up old feelings of those past back alley dealers (B.A.D) not responding and robbing them. It makes a person feel like a fool when they get taken. Being experienced in this lifestyle makes you then kick yourself for thinking anything was different and you should have known better- until SR came back up. Then they realized they put their foot in their mouth. I have experienced this with my local vendors as well as in other situations in life where I jumped the gun and in those cases you have to be humble and just apologize and learn from the situation. True professionals will usually let it go--well I guess that depends on how bad you flip out and what you say/do. I think people understand its an illicit trade but that doesnt make it any better if you get ripped off. There are chances of bad things happening and people take them but its only human nature to complain or warn others to communicate the frustration/anger. If it did turn out that DPR split with the BTC would they have been morons then? Not just that but I think this is typical of a situation like this. A bunch of people get robbed-at first no one says anything because they think its just late. Then a few start to talk and gather information and worry. Then it starts one by one each person gives up on anything coming through at some point until everyone is talking about it and is in agreement. There are people like me that even though everyone has been ripped off and its clear I will still hold out doing anything besides talking about it until long after I should have. I wont jump the gun--learned from past mistakes. So everyone is different and I dont think anyone was wrong for worrying/being angry. Yes some of the comments were overboard but like I said everyone is different. SR could be gone at anytime its true but there are and will be others. Alot of people bad talk other sites (BMR) and wont accept anything other then SR in this business but alot more people including vendors use both sites. Where did alot of people go in the downtime do you think? I dont believe everyone just sat there or just used the forums to order. If you dont have local access and your connection is down what are you going to do? What do people do locally? Call someone you dont normally go see. Is that a lack of loyalty to your dealer? No its just business. With all the choices you have in your town to eat do you just visit the one? No you go where you are treated right where the food/prices are good and where it is convienient for you. You may have a favorite but that doesnt mean you wont go anywhere else. This is what would happen if SR was gone more sites would pop up and people would migrate over. So I agree people need to apreciate SR for the wonder that it is but to treat it as if it is the last of a dying breed is backwards.  There are people with the mindset that it takes them the buyers/vendors to make the business a business. Alot of people dont look at it like they are fortunate to be there but that SR is fortunate to have them. Not that I think that is the correct way of viewing things but others do. Also alot of these people didnt have BTC just sitting in their accounts. Not everyone just deposits BTC only when they need a quick buy. Some have BTC going back and forth all the time. Maybe they did just deposit it like you suggest but the site went down or others that made purchases but the vendors couldnt see or do anything so they did what you suggest but the timing was bad. thats just the buyers. Vendors that were waiting for escrow to release for purcahses shipped and the purchaes that are new orders that are waiting to be shipped-do they ship them? So alot of different situations could be the motivating force behind the (now I am using your word:) "spazathon" that took place here. All Im really saying is I think everyone needs to cut everyone a break. Those that flipped and those that didnt. You can understand someones motivations without condoning them. I dont think it is a matter of new/old members not understanding the drug trade either I agree that maybe some sort of tutorial could be written that would address what to do in the event of another "spazathon" (theres that word again!) sort of an in case of emergency guide. You wouldnt want me to write it. My forum postings are novels. Im sorry but its how I talk and how I write. I cant be brief no matter how I try. I read someone say that DPR will regain his credit in time after this is all over but I see it differently. The site went down and with people flipping out and all the stress that guy must have if there was going to be an oppourtunity and a reason (Its hard to fix, feds, scammers,etc) to split with everyones BTC this would have been it. Instead the guy breaks his ass getting it back up he avoids the shit flinging in here and he produces a near-finished site that sounds like it is running better and he is still at work. I know customer support was lacking in some areas but considering the amount of people that tried to contact them I can understand why that might be a factor. I imagine that as time goes by he will find ways to improve on that as well. This was most definately a learning experience for DPR as well as for us the members. I dont know if it will even happen again once the dust settles on this but if it does everyone will behave differently as well as DPR I think.  A positive thing has come out of this in my opinion and some will see it this way and some wont but I give MORE credit/trust to DPR now. His dedication and intentions seem clear to me if only for the time being although I dont think a time will come when his intentions change. These type of guys are in it to the end whatever that may be. This is his baby and he loves it. Makes me feel alot more confidence in SR. Wrote a novel here soaponarope but im just in a discussion with you not an arguement. :D

Maybe you can afford to juggle the money around but not everyone can. Thus the reason he has handled this professionaly and not got caught up in the commotion. Everyone understands the risk and I dont think there is anyone who doesnt thank DPR and everyone else that contributes to what makes this all work (its not just DPR) but at the same time these people are also contributing to the community that is at the heart of this. They pay their fees and follow the rules. These people make the system possible and in that respect and in this particular case forgiveness and understanding should be at the top of everyones list right now. Then there is the other foot that you can try my shoe on: im a SR member who split with their significant other. I need to start an account of my own now. I have been waiting just like you. Should I be "halted" from registering a new account? What if it was you that just found SR like some of the new registers have. You remember how excited you were to see it? Well you cant join because your new. Hopefully you can understand where im coming from and you take this the right way. Try not to have a "spazathon" over it. ;)

Well for the time being the site has obvs been struggling so the obvious thing would be to do would be halt new users. Dpr has already commented on the ' explosive growth'
I dont think at the moment SR will lose any buisness.
It was mostly newbies who flipped out but thats my opinion.

Ive only just started as a vendor. after a week of it working out, it was down for a week so yes i can clearly see new ppl registering needs to be halted. I was also a buyer from near the start of SR so i can see how the issue has come about. Im thinking about all the decent vendors and buyers and future registrations. I would rather DPR took time to improve the site instead of allowing new accounts and crashing the site again. You will find the longer serving members didnt panic withdraw BTC's. Im not superior i just want the site to work. I understand there are decent sensible ppl who want to register an account. To people who have been around here a while, like Megatron himself, there's more than meets the eye going on with SR and DPR...

I'm assuming you're relatively new based on that you've written four posts, probably all praising DPR and the "TEAM" but here's a fun fact for you, DPR who started this place is LOOOONG gone my friend and chances are exceedingly good LEO's now got control of this and using it as a honeypot service the outage. The mods and DPR'S writing style changed again to basically nothing but shit. Saying stuff like "Our beloved DPR will be on in 12hrs to address the situation" yet we appreciate the guy, the real DPR of old, but mods don't write that way and as for DPR's posts, they look more like a point form memo to a secretary to type up... any surprises there?

Those of us who have been around for a while know THE ORIGINAL DPR's an awesome guy, who likes to hang out in the forums and always ran a "tight ship" but since he sold the boat, (for way more than it will prove to be worth because the new LEO team who intercepted it soon after can't manage it properly being "white hats" most fresh out of their five year college courses, don't know WTF they're doing with criminal minds systems) he's a happy man who's sailed off into the sunset.

The team that took over gave it a pleasant new look, I'll give them that, but they weren't as tech savvy as THE DPR who oversaw everything, the system's security was shattered, (fucking spam bots could get in FFS) and people honestly think the NSA can't? LMFAO!

The reason they put shit up not working properly is to quell suspicions but also because the LEO IT guys had to almost reverse engineer the system to figure it out, as well as re-activate well known vendors who have been absent for months OFFICIALLY, in order to get some people buying off them again to start tracking and tracing things and infiltrating some syndicates, even though to the trained eye the prices and accounts aren't the same people, almost like a BMR knock off.

This new Govt support also explains the new blistering speed it's going at because after all, running off Pentagon supercomputers/servers it's going to be much quicker.

Every time you place an order your details BTC, address and name etc as well as what you've got will be recorded in their new automated system they would have put in there, and six to twelve months from now, Silk Road will make Farmers Market look like a street corner dime bag bust, as well as this they will have siphoned off and kept all BTC's they deem unnecessary to the operation and so at the end of all this shit they can say look how much we made for you the people from the "bad guys" and you can all rest easier now.

Silk Road makes between 20 and 30 million a year in sales, the illicit drug war earns over 400Billion, yet busting SR will look better to them than killing Bin Laden, Pablo Escobar and the Ramirez Brothers all at once, even though there's more value in drugs sitting in one little favela in Peru than everything SR has to offer!

I LOVED THIS PLACE AT THE START, NOW IT'S ABOUT DRUGO'S AND MONEY AND INSTEAD OF A FUNFAIR FEELS LIKE AN ARAB BAZAAR, NOT LOVE, LIBERTARIANISM FREE TRADE AND MUTUAL RESPECT... ESPECIALLY FROM THE SR "SUPPORT TEAM", A FUCKING MISNOMER IF I'VE HEARD ONE!!!

It's hard for people who've joined in the last 6-9 months to understand what we mean by how much it's changed and it's not the same place, but they'll learn, especially when LEO kicks in their doors to ruin their lives over some smack and a couple of grams of cocaine.

C'est la vi!

Be smart folks, and use PGP to send your details NOT the SR checkout system, if you have to use it at all. My advice, find good vendors and stick to them inside or outside SR.

Peace!!! - JWM

The GREAT thing about this place is I dont have to come back to this forum and I can still join when registration opens. On top of all that those of you that feel since you are a member so no one else should get in its not going to happen. Nothing can and nothing will change. DPR is running this game not a handful of people/kids that have nothing but time to camp out in forums all day posting comments making threads and blogs and polls and whatever else you time wasters do. All you want is a good ass kissing a day for writing in these forums and getting your posting count up. Dont say no because I know your kind. You dont go outside you live here. So say something smart for your "friends" and think you got me they will all kiss your ass good but really they know it and you know it. Cant lie to everyone the proof is evident. If I dont see your reply or any other comments from your shitmouth in this forum for that matter I dont think my life will be affected. Since you are so worried about punctuation and grammar even though you cant read go ahead and edit my posting. Someone will tell you "good boy!" +1 and you can do a spin on your fat ass in your computer chair. Something just occured to me. If I was a vendor I wouldnt go around pissing people off in forums. That could be bad for future business. Other members see it and act accordingly. Not just that but in this business you dont piss off addicts they are horribly vengeful. Well your lucky im not like that and im lucky im not a vendor but that is something for everyone to consider if your a vendor. Think about it all the problems it could cause. Well I dont want to piss off any vendors I might want to use so this is my last novel and my last visit to SR forums. Never needed them before anyway.

To people who have been around here a while, like Megatron himself, there's more than meets the eye going on with SR and DPR...

I'm assuming you're relatively new based on that you've written four posts, probably all praising DPR and the "TEAM" but here's a fun fact for you, DPR who started this place is LOOOONG gone my friend and chances are exceedingly good LEO's now got control of this and using it as a honeypot service the outage. The mods and DPR'S writing style changed again to basically nothing but shit. Saying stuff like "Our beloved DPR will be on in 12hrs to address the situation" yet we appreciate the guy, the real DPR of old, but mods don't write that way and as for DPR's posts, they look more like a point form memo to a secretary to type up... any surprises there?

Those of us who have been around for a while know THE ORIGINAL DPR's an awesome guy, who likes to hang out in the forums and always ran a "tight ship" but since he sold the boat, (for way more than it will prove to be worth because the new LEO team who intercepted it soon after can't manage it properly being "white hats" most fresh out of their five year college courses, don't know WTF they're doing with criminal minds systems) he's a happy man who's sailed off into the sunset.

The team that took over gave it a pleasant new look, I'll give them that, but they weren't as tech savvy as THE DPR who oversaw everything, the system's security was shattered, (fucking spam bots could get in FFS) and people honestly think the NSA can't? LMFAO!

The reason they put shit up not working properly is to quell suspicions but also because the LEO IT guys had to almost reverse engineer the system to figure it out, as well as re-activate well known vendors who have been absent for months OFFICIALLY, in order to get some people buying off them again to start tracking and tracing things and infiltrating some syndicates, even though to the trained eye the prices and accounts aren't the same people, almost like a BMR knock off.

This new Govt support also explains the new blistering speed it's going at because after all, running off Pentagon supercomputers/servers it's going to be much quicker.

Every time you place an order your details BTC, address and name etc as well as what you've got will be recorded in their new automated system they would have put in there, and six to twelve months from now, Silk Road will make Farmers Market look like a street corner dime bag bust, as well as this they will have siphoned off and kept all BTC's they deem unnecessary to the operation and so at the end of all this shit they can say look how much we made for you the people from the "bad guys" and you can all rest easier now.

Silk Road makes between 20 and 30 million a year in sales, the illicit drug war earns over 400Billion, yet busting SR will look better to them than killing Bin Laden, Pablo Escobar and the Ramirez Brothers all at once, even though there's more value in drugs sitting in one little favela in Peru than everything SR has to offer!

I LOVED THIS PLACE AT THE START, NOW IT'S ABOUT DRUGO'S AND MONEY AND INSTEAD OF A FUNFAIR FEELS LIKE AN ARAB BAZAAR, NOT LOVE, LIBERTARIANISM FREE TRADE AND MUTUAL RESPECT... ESPECIALLY FROM THE SR "SUPPORT TEAM", A FUCKING MISNOMER IF I'VE HEARD ONE!!!

It's hard for people who've joined in the last 6-9 months to understand what we mean by how much it's changed and it's not the same place, but they'll learn, especially when LEO kicks in their doors to ruin their lives over some smack and a couple of grams of cocaine.

C'est la vi!

Be smart folks, and use PGP to send your details NOT the SR checkout system, if you have to use it at all. My advice, find good vendors and stick to them inside or outside SR.

Peace!!! - JWM

So the vendors that are there can have the existing buyers only. As time goes on and vendors fade away does DPR open it up to just new vendors? As well as you are restricting vendors to the existing members only. Where will new registers go? Thats where the vendors will follow to and SR will lose out on all of that business. When you say "a way to block all these morons" I assume you are refering to all the current members who flipped out while SR was down? Both vendors and buyers. As well as you must be refering to the existing members that are trying to scam for BTCs. Has nothing to do with new registers. I think the bottom line is you have an account and its working and thats all you are thinking about. Also if you consider the site going down and having its members freaking out about being ripped off is limelight I question your thinking all together. If anything it made members pull their BTCs out and others steer clear but thats what you would have anyway. New registers they wernt here when you were so by seniority that makes you superior. I have met people like that. They usually wont help other users (definately not newbies) and look at themselves as privlidged for "being there first" although they are just another one of the masses. Its easy to call others behaviors obnoxious when you have no investment in the object that is at risk. I would like to see (although I can predict) how you would behave if the situation was different. If you had a large amount of BTC or maybe someone elses tied up. Maybe you can afford to juggle the money around but not everyone can. Im not saying everyones reactions were sensible but there is a justifiable reason to be worried and for that and combined with their different characters and the variables of their addiction as well as their financial state--I understand as I think DPR does. Thus the reason he has handled this professionaly and not got caught up in the commotion. Everyone understands the risk and I dont think there is anyone who doesnt thank DPR and everyone else that contributes to what makes this all work (its not just DPR) but at the same time these people are also contributing to the community that is at the heart of this. They pay their fees and follow the rules. These people make the system possible and in that respect and in this particular case forgiveness and understanding should be at the top of everyones list right now. Then there is the other foot that you can try my shoe on: im a SR member who split with their significant other. I need to start an account of my own now. I have been waiting just like you. Should I be "halted" from registering a new account? What if it was you that just found SR like some of the new registers have. You remember how excited you were to see it? Well you cant join because your new. Hopefully you can understand where im coming from and you take this the right way. Try not to have a "spazathon" over it. ;)

Well for the time being the site has obvs been struggling so the obvious thing would be to do would be halt new users. Dpr has already commented on the ' explosive growth'
I dont think at the moment SR will lose any buisness.
It was mostly newbies who flipped out but thats my opinion.

Ive only just started as a vendor. after a week of it working out, it was down for a week so yes i can clearly see new ppl registering needs to be halted. I was also a buyer from near the start of SR so i can see how the issue has come about. Im thinking about all the decent vendors and buyers and future registrations. I would rather DPR took time to improve the site instead of allowing new accounts and crashing the site again. You will find the longer serving members didnt panic withdraw BTC's. Im not superior i just want the site to work. I understand there are decent sensible ppl who want to register an account. Im not saying they cant because they are new, im saying not having anyone new register is the sensible thing to do as the site cant handle it right. and a lot of the newbs comments on here arent going to help to persuade DPR to change his mind anytime soon.

This is what im talking about. I agree with you in your clearified statement. I understand both sides but your original post came off in a different way or thats how I took it. I always sa'y the problem with textsemails is there is no tone of voice. people shorten their thoughts and misunderstandings happen. Thanks for your professional response. I take back the points in which I thought you were presenting yourself as superior. ;D

This is not a rant or dig at you two i just thought it was relevant to the conversation

From all the retarded comments Ive been reading on this thread it seems that the ones who talk the most bollocks already have SR accounts, they are just new to the forum. I think its not so much about the quantity of customers but the quality of customers. There's been way too many ranting and raving because they might loose a couple of hundred quid. Boo hoo, these are the people who need to be ejected as they obviously have no idea about the drug trade. Id like to see them bitch and moan if they done a deal down a back alley and got a gun in their face and ripped off at the same time. Would they shout "well i don't get treated like this in my local supermarket!" The mugger would probably then shoot them for being so stupid. At least they don't have that fear here thats why they rant and moan and show themselves to be true morons. This is an illicit trade and sometimes shit happens. DON'T TREAT IT LIKE AMAZON!!! SR could be gone at anytime and its forum,then where you gonna go to cry? If you don't have it to loose don't leave it lying around in your SR wallet for convenience ! deposit only when your buying that way if it was to vanish you at least have cut down the damage to you. Maybe a trusted invite system is whats required so only existing members can induct new members rather than just any tom dick or harry getting access. That way at least their is some way of vetting new members and ensuring they are up to speed with the drug trade. Geeze i don't believe Ive had to state the obvious. Some people if they had brains they would be deadly.

Again lads this wasn't aimed at you but the 'community' or lack there of as a whole. Peace and love x

Some thoughts on what you said-not aimed at attacking you or anything. The people that have been making the most noise arent just new users to the forum. Its not a matter of how long you have been using the forums that determines behaviors especially when we could be talking about addicts. I just think some people reacted diffferently then others and depending on the feedback they recieved it could go one way or the other. Based on what I saw many other members didnt help the situation with their comments. Alot of people dont want to be told they are wrong for fearing their money is gone. They also dont want to be told that this is like a back alley dealer when before this the key focus has been on building a community that runs on trust. Speaking of the the back alley senerio isnt that why we are here anyway? To avoid that sort of situation. To act more as professionals. As far as the quality of the the members goes there will never be a way to get rid of scammers completely. The nature of the business and the online world makes it near impossible to run something like this without having troublemakers. Look at eBay no matter what they implement scammers get in and scam. The quality of user ranges on eBay just like it does here. Again I dont think limiting members will fix this. Membership fees might help weed out some but having invites by current members only means that the current members that are scammers can invite their scammer friends. Members will start selling accounts (like I have been offered) and then your right back where you started Its hard to have a site where you need to protect your identity but be able to verify members are not scammers. Even legit vendors turn into scammers sometimes so you cant be sure about anyone. Think about it.You say not to treat this like Amazon but why not? That is what we all would prefer isnt it? A site that is easy to use and you can buy what you want. Lots of options and lots of content. Maybe some buyer protection? I think you might have meant dont expect it to work like Amazon meaning there are scammers? Because there are scammers on Amazon too. I get the general point that SR is an underground operation and you cant expect it to have the same policys/behaviors that Amazon has but it could run with the same efficentcy (spelling?). The drug trade and back alley dealers are two different types of entities. In truth a professional in the drug trade runs things like a business and has many of the same practices that we use on SR. Where as a back alley dealer is someone who is usually an addict themselves who sells to support their own habit and that means your going to get screwed around. Many of us have been at this for MANY years working and suffering our way through these people to get to the professionals. We remember the back alley dealers though and that could be partially why some members flipped out. People have become acustomed to trusting SR not just their favorite vendors and when it looked like they wernt getting the response they wanted out of DPR it brought up old feelings of those past back alley dealers (B.A.D) not responding and robbing them. It makes a person feel like a fool when they get taken. Being experienced in this lifestyle makes you then kick yourself for thinking anything was different and you should have known better- until SR came back up. Then they realized they put their foot in their mouth. I have experienced this with my local vendors as well as in other situations in life where I jumped the gun and in those cases you have to be humble and just apologize and learn from the situation. True professionals will usually let it go--well I guess that depends on how bad you flip out and what you say/do. I think people understand its an illicit trade but that doesnt make it any better if you get ripped off. There are chances of bad things happening and people take them but its only human nature to complain or warn others to communicate the frustration/anger. If it did turn out that DPR split with the BTC would they have been morons then? Not just that but I think this is typical of a situation like this. A bunch of people get robbed-at first no one says anything because they think its just late. Then a few start to talk and gather information and worry. Then it starts one by one each person gives up on anything coming through at some point until everyone is talking about it and is in agreement. There are people like me that even though everyone has been ripped off and its clear I will still hold out doing anything besides talking about it until long after I should have. I wont jump the gun--learned from past mistakes. So everyone is different and I dont think anyone was wrong for worrying/being angry. Yes some of the comments were overboard but like I said everyone is different. SR could be gone at anytime its true but there are and will be others. Alot of people bad talk other sites (BMR) and wont accept anything other then SR in this business but alot more people including vendors use both sites. Where did alot of people go in the downtime do you think? I dont believe everyone just sat there or just used the forums to order. If you dont have local access and your connection is down what are you going to do? What do people do locally? Call someone you dont normally go see. Is that a lack of loyalty to your dealer? No its just business. With all the choices you have in your town to eat do you just visit the one? No you go where you are treated right where the food/prices are good and where it is convienient for you. You may have a favorite but that doesnt mean you wont go anywhere else. This is what would happen if SR was gone more sites would pop up and people would migrate over. So I agree people need to apreciate SR for the wonder that it is but to treat it as if it is the last of a dying breed is backwards.  There are people with the mindset that it takes them the buyers/vendors to make the business a business. Alot of people dont look at it like they are fortunate to be there but that SR is fortunate to have them. Not that I think that is the correct way of viewing things but others do. Also alot of these people didnt have BTC just sitting in their accounts. Not everyone just deposits BTC only when they need a quick buy. Some have BTC going back and forth all the time. Maybe they did just deposit it like you suggest but the site went down or others that made purchases but the vendors couldnt see or do anything so they did what you suggest but the timing was bad. thats just the buyers. Vendors that were waiting for escrow to release for purcahses shipped and the purchaes that are new orders that are waiting to be shipped-do they ship them? So alot of different situations could be the motivating force behind the (now I am using your word:) "spazathon" that took place here. All Im really saying is I think everyone needs to cut everyone a break. Those that flipped and those that didnt. You can understand someones motivations without condoning them. I dont think it is a matter of new/old members not understanding the drug trade either I agree that maybe some sort of tutorial could be written that would address what to do in the event of another "spazathon" (theres that word again!) sort of an in case of emergency guide. You wouldnt want me to write it. My forum postings are novels. Im sorry but its how I talk and how I write. I cant be brief no matter how I try. I read someone say that DPR will regain his credit in time after this is all over but I see it differently. The site went down and with people flipping out and all the stress that guy must have if there was going to be an oppourtunity and a reason (Its hard to fix, feds, scammers,etc) to split with everyones BTC this would have been it. Instead the guy breaks his ass getting it back up he avoids the shit flinging in here and he produces a near-finished site that sounds like it is running better and he is still at work. I know customer support was lacking in some areas but considering the amount of people that tried to contact them I can understand why that might be a factor. I imagine that as time goes by he will find ways to improve on that as well. This was most definately a learning experience for DPR as well as for us the members. I dont know if it will even happen again once the dust settles on this but if it does everyone will behave differently as well as DPR I think.  A positive thing has come out of this in my opinion and some will see it this way and some wont but I give MORE credit/trust to DPR now. His dedication and intentions seem clear to me if only for the time being although I dont think a time will come when his intentions change. These type of guys are in it to the end whatever that may be. This is his baby and he loves it. Makes me feel alot more confidence in SR. Wrote a novel here soaponarope but im just in a discussion with you not an arguement. :D

I need someone to type my essay up you've got the job  ;)

Title: Re: update- a few issues that have me a little noided still
Post by: ribley on November 17, 2012, 03:09 am
a few things that have me wondering about using the 'new' SR, i do not share any of the fears of DPR & crew scamming, that seems silly, i am however concerned of the LE possibility and feel that there is no such thing as to much paranoia in that case, at least for me
   1- DPR - posted recently apologizing if he sounds different, said changing style to avoid profiling. great if so, good thinking, on other hand, very likely post LE mite post had they compromised DPR and were writing posts themselves
  2- DPR - 'movie nite' post advising all to use torrent link, arrousing security concern with some. i would think DPR would be aware of such concern, or at least post thought on matter. maybe im not understanding something, seems odd.
  3- SR - DPR posting that all good, opening new reg due to can handle it now, but same issues are still there, kicking out when logged in, 3,2,or 1 digi captchas...does not seem fixed, does certainly not seem ready for any more strain w/new members boosting use. if it is a LE situ they would want as many to reg as poss while cat still in bag.
  4- have had 2times prob communicating w/old vendor using their original key. as if they are not being able to decrypt w/original key.
  5- new vendors that have shown up during blackout. this is odd, maybe they were new in the day or two before blackout & i did not see, also seems like many new pics up of product when pics almost never changed before. seems odd so many vends would be on the ball enough to use blackout time to update photos, i dont know, maybe this is paranoid mind playing trix w/me, maybe not. along this line can anyone vouch TranceFamily was on SR pre-blackout? not trying to question this vendor, i could have easily missed seeing before, but i think i would have remember a vendor w/so many colorful pics. please advise if this is unfounded, and apology to TF if so.

  just my wondering, please reply with thoughts. crazy hate reply not needed, wont be read. thank you to others smart enough to know only one to depend on watching u ass is u.

Title: Re: update

Expect a bit of a wait though, I can only imagine that SR support is backed up with a few thousand irate users waiting for an instant response (as if SR support is a computational instant answer machine when it's in fact a few tired as fuck people getting barraged with insults and impatience trying to sort out everyone's woes :( )

Title: Re: update
Post by: strangemagic on November 17, 2012, 07:28 am
Thank you DPR and Team for all your hard work.

I know it's a bastard when you're expecting free time and then have to deal with issues like these under continuous pressure. I hope you get the r&r you need and deserve after all this.

Thanks also to the rock solid Vendors who were patient throughout, kept their customers informed, and felt no need to participate in the spazathon. (And thanks Nomad Bloodbath for the terminology).

My experiences of SR in the last 24 hours:
- Made a bitcoin deposit, coins landed within one hour.
- Exchanged messages with a vendor.
- Placed an order with said vendor.
- Still getting occasional logouts, but can work around for now.
- Otherwise, mostly finding the site to be at least as fast as before (and at the time of writing, very fast indeed).

You've all done a great job, and I for one will do my duty and continue to buy :-)

Thanks again,
~ sm

Post by: JezuzWazaMushroom on November 17, 2012, 02:23 pm
Quote from: ribley on November 17, 2012, 03:09 am
a few things that have me wondering about using the 'new' SR, i do not share any of the fears of DPR & crew scamming, that seems silly, i am however concerned of the LE possibility and feel that there is no such thing as to much paranoia in that case, at least for me
   1- DPR - posted recently apologizing if he sounds different, said changing style to avoid profiling. great if so, good thinking, on other hand, very likely post LE mite post had they compromised DPR and were writing posts themselves
  2- DPR - 'movie nite' post advising all to use torrent link, arrousing security concern with some. i would think DPR would be aware of such concern, or at least post thought on matter. maybe im not understanding something, seems odd.
  3- SR - DPR posting that all good, opening new reg due to can handle it now, but same issues are still there, kicking out when logged in, 3,2,or 1 digi captchas...does not seem fixed, does certainly not seem ready for any more strain w/new members boosting use. if it is a LE situ they would want as many to reg as poss while cat still in bag.

  5- new vendors that have shown up during blackout. this is odd, maybe they were new in the day or two before blackout & i did not see, also seems like many new pics up of product when pics almost never changed before. seems odd so many vends would be on the ball enough to use blackout time to update photos, i dont know, maybe this is paranoid mind playing trix w/me, maybe not. along this line can anyone vouch TranceFamily was on SR pre-blackout? not trying to question this vendor, i could have easily missed seeing before, but i think i would have remember a vendor w/so many colorful pics. please advise if this is unfounded, and apology to TF if so.

  just my wondering, please reply with thoughts. crazy hate reply not needed, wont be read. thank you to others smart enough to know only one to depend on watching u ass is u.


I started a thread two days ago and there were no mods or anything and today about half an hour after posting this my thread was deleted and there was a new statement from "DPR" regarding the site etc.
I have been in discussion with one of the MOD's on here who said he'd been in discussion with DPR daily and is a really good bloke IMO and has calmed my nerves a bit however I'm still locked out of my account and I'm also still out of pocket 150BTC that was never processed into my account although it shows clearly in the block chain then was slowly taken out in strange increments.

Here's what I posted...

Here's what I posted on my thread about half an hour before it was deleted and this magical "DPR" post came along to counter it.

Personally I think they saw us old hats pointing out too many things they didn't like, so I'll do it again and I SERIOUSLY suggest you and others read the whole thing as I know some people have attention spans of as long as it takes to read a TV timetable but it's important information people MUST consider in this place.

from last nights thread that I didn't post before I fell asleep...

You all say this while I've been away having a private chat with a MAJOR VENDOR and he's worried about whether to pull his coins or if he'll even get them, or if he should just try one first and see how long that takes. You guys have no idea, you act like I'm saying this to be a cunt, when it's the fucking opposite you idiots there's people who know shit you don't and you guys don't think of it from all angles. WTF do you think I haven't been banned as you would love so much?

You're like Creationists arguing with an Evolutionist! I'm saying look at the facts and the bigger picture of things, as others have, and you're just going along with "God's Word" like it's gospel, and we all know the fucking bibles a myth of it's infallibility. For the hundredth time, I LOVE SILK ROAD, the REAL SILK ROAD I know without suspect shit and lies, dodgy support, zero addresses. Get off the meth and have a cone or two and really contemplate what's going on here. I WOULD LOVE TO BE WRONG, AND I HOPE I AM, I'm just saying to people be fucking careful. It's obvious if run of the mill hackers and spammers can break into the system, there's nothing stopping the NSA.

I read the book by the team who took out Pablo Escobar, and in the 80's they had a plane that could fly over Medellin, switch his phone on without him knowing and triangulate the position and switch it back off again. In the end they caught him in this manner over 20 years ago.

Imagine what they would have now, in a network they built?

You people to me seem a little bit relaxed about your lives and freedoms and I'm being more concerned for you than you are!

Remember it came out DPR sold the road in August I think it was, two weeks later they had that big upgrade but were obviously competent with the system and knew it in and out.

This time it's completely different. We remember the OLD DPR, that was who we trusted and it was earned trust, now the DPR thing as far as an almost brand quality thing can't be applied to someone who's done nothing even close to DPR himself and therefore SR isn't the same because DPR WAS SR, and for all we know it could be a gang of people now running it employing outside IT workers to monitor it who don't get it quite yet OR the other gang or gangs, fucking governments of some sort. LEO is my gut feeling because a group interested in keeping the DPR quality up wouldn't be treating people the way they are, and it's not just me.

I'm asking you to take your drug hat off for a minute and put on your rationality one and think long and hard about the shit from all angles.

If you had a consiglierie  and he didn't give you impartial advice like this he wouldn't be doing his job, and I'm actually trying to be a fucking helpful member of the "community" or what's left of it I'm not here to have troll battles!

Rational debates and discussion are what adults have, unless they're religious people, insults are for people with nothing constructive to say!

Here's a quote from a well known vendor on another forum... yes there's more SR ones than this!

“Users of the site worship him.”..this is blatantly false. There are a couple of n00bs that express this type of admiration, but people like myself, who have been on the road for over a year, well…we do not “worship” him. He is just another mod, and he used to be a vendor on the site before it got to big. Now he realises that it would be dangerous for himself to vend, as all LE would have to do is order from him. Also, you say there is no one who knows who he is. no one knows him. *ahem* again, this is not true. There are many who know him on the forums. I will not say who, but if you have been there long enough, you would know. "

Think what you want but if you're in a cell worried about spending the next ten years behind bars remember this, and the Australian Federal Police might not have been lying when they arrested old mate in Melbourne by working on what appears to be some secret SR taskforce they've setup, because Interpol's World Wide Cybercrime Headquaters are in Sydney.

Our Prime Minister said on TV recently after Julian Assange revealed how much info governments share, freely admitted they all willy nilly trade info on citizens and they have the power to put a fucking solar powered truck sized buggy thing on Mars, so WTF and who the fuck are SR in comparison? SR had to be compromised sometime IMO!

I HOPE I'M WRONG, I REALLY DO BUT THE SR WE USED TO KNOW WOULDN'T BE WITH HOLDING $2100 of someone's money after contacting them almost instantly then when provided evidence disappear and yet they were still online sending similar messages to other people. I suggest you read the missing BTC threads there's a few, none of which were started by me but I did show some of them how to view the block chain, and one guy actually watched it get moved out before his very eyes the poor bloke, again a 9th or 10th deposit.

You have the hide to abuse me when all I'm doing is making you use your brains, or have you fried those already and critical reasoning and abstract thought are too much for you?

I've been up all night stressed because of these people, taken 40 mg of oxycodone, 20mg diazepam plus weed and I'm still unable to sleep I'm so pissed.

By doing my mate a favour, at this stage now I have to pay him back plus he won't make his money or have his weed for Christmas, and because I won't credit my other account with money because of what's happened and that's still happening to people I'm going local again for some smoko.

In the last two months thee have been about 30 or 40 SR arrests here, one guy killed himself on NBOMe ordered through here by taking too much in a forest and running into trees of all things from hallucinating so hard.

It smells like BACON and furthermore, soon to be broken EGGS!

I started a thread two days ago and there were no mods or anything and today about half an hour after posting this my thread was deleted and there was a new statement from "DPR" regarding the site etc.
I have been in discussion with one of the MOD's on here who said he'd been in discussion with DPR daily and is a really good bloke IMO and has calmed my nerves a bit however I'm still locked out of my account and I'm also still out of pocket 150BTC that was never processed into my account although it shows clearly in the block chain then was slowly taken out in strange increments.

Here's what I posted...

Here's what I posted on my thread about half an hour before it was deleted and this magical "DPR" post came along to counter it.

from last nights thread that I didn't post before I fell asleep...
